review: We haven't fried anything that could go in here since buying it.
Chips are really nice when cooked in the Airfryer, much less greasy than then frying, but not as dry as oven chips.
The timer is accurate, and we have not had any issues with cooking times (providing you give whatever cooking a shake about halfway through).
I would however recommend holding out for a sale on this item. It normally comes down to around £70-£80 during Black Friday and over Christmas, as well as random times throughout the year.

I'm 100% sold on the air fryer concept.  This gadget is so easy and convenient to use.  I feel like some onion rings.  BAM!  Ready in 10 mins.  I can't be bothered to cook tonight.  Stick in a chicken breast in the air fryer and some frozen veggies in the microwave.  BAM!  A healthy dinner in 10 mins.  Like the microwave, its an instant on set it and forget it device.  Its so much quicker and easier than warming up a huge oven and food develops a crisp skin far more easily.

This would be a 5 star device if the internal basket was non stick.  As a wire mesh I find food gets welded on requiring overnight soaking to remove.  Fish skin is the worst.  That has to be burnt off (10mins with no food at a hot setting in the air fryer) as no amount of soaking or scrubbing will remove it from the mesh.  My next air fryer will definitely have a non stick basket.
Also this isn't great with burgers or sausages as thick smoke starts to come out after they start cooking.  Its totally fine with proper bits of meat.
Not much to add to the thousands of other reviews, other than to share my satisfaction really.

I believe that once you've tried the Philips airfryer, you won't go back to the hob, oven or grill for *most* smaller things, but you've got to pick your foodstuffs. I've had fabulous success with chips (obviously), chicken, burgers, fish (battered and uncoated), pork belly (small joint), sausages and even homemade sausage rolls (i.e. sausage meat wrapped in puff pastry)!

I cannot stress how much I also recommend buying the ridiculously overpriced "Philips HD9910/20 – Accessory for Airfryer Grill Pan Non Stick – Black" (ASIN: B00GP2YWDI). I use the non stick pan much more than the basket that comes with the airfyer and it's a breeze to clean.
Used to make homemade chips - potato/sweet potato.
Although they don’t taste like chips done in a chip pan - which is to be expected with only half a teaspoon of oil used - they do taste great. Crisp all round with fluffy potato inside.
Got it via an Amazon deal and it was well worth purchasing.

I’ve gone through two of these and my main complaint is that the mesh basket is VERY hard to clean. You really need to do it every time you use it.  Being a lazy so-and-so I let it go three or four times and thus get a build up which I can’t shift.  Apart from that I love it and wouldn’t be without it.

I loved the idea of this. I was seduced by the pictures of lovely crisp golden chips. The reality is somewhat different. I have yet to reproduce anything looking at all like the pictures. The theory is sound, but the reality is flawed. I suggest that if you like chips, and you don't have them every day, then buy a deep fat fryer and do your best to drain off the fat after cooking. You'll never be disappointed with the outcome.

so glad i bought this..we use the oven less now, i just cooked bacon in mine this morning. i put an egg into a ramekin and it cooked perfectly. kids cook thier own nuggets sausages etc. no fat needed. i experiment every week with something new.

This is super wonderful, I made the best chips ever from frying packed frozen chips from Tesco. And chicken wings, shrimps are no problem. The only common complaints from my colleagues are the frying net can get some residual like from the chicken wings thus a little hard to clean. I think you will just need to have a brush kind of cleaning tool with warm water to brush through the frying net and it's totally ok.

Simply one of the best things I've ever bought. Has completely changed the game in the kitchen. I haven't turned on the oven once since I bought it. The only caution I would give is that the capacity is not big. It's prefect for cooking dinner for one. You could probably fit enough for two people but that's the limit.

This really is a very handy kitchen appliance.  I use it in place of my oven for smaller dishes and it's great for chips.  Make sure to soak the cut potatoes, then place them in a bag with some oil to coat them and have them at a lower temp (about 120) for 20 mins before turning it up to crisp them.  Tastes like deep-fried chips without the excess oil.

the gas oven has had limited use since this arrived.  Easy to use, easy to clean and a compact addition that sits next to my microwave.  For those who have never used one, the best advice I can give is to ensure you give the airfryer a few minutes of warming up time before cooking anything - just like you would a normal oven...  I normally give it 3 mins on full power before I use it to cook.

We bought this in 2016 and this is the best product EVER we bought in that year, it is that good! Mind you, for best results, you need to wash it in a dishwasher. Apart from this, the food, once you get used to preparing it in this appliance, is pretty good.

This thing is a life saver, when I first bought it for my mum I wasn't sure it would find much use but since we bought it, it's pretty much put the fryer out of business. it's in constant use and produces a good fried taste to the food we buy. Can't say i have too many complaints about this 5 stars.
My 5 stars is based on this fryer being half of it's original price, I actually got it at 40% of it's original price a few months ago.
This is a great fryer and while we use it for all sorts of items like chips (straight from potatoes), bacon, sauages it's great that you don't need to cook them with additional oil.
Easy to use and quick to cook the only negative is the size of the frying section itself. We are a family of four and it's just about big enough. A larger family may find it too small.
It's also easy to clean the frying section in the dishwasher.
5 Stars.

I love this airfryer.  I had a relative that had one so I had already had a chance to sample the cooked food.  We have cooked a variety of food - chips, chicken, salmon, fishpie.  Everything comes out perfectly and the chips are slightly crunchy without the 'soaked in oil' taste.  Really healthy and cooks quicker than the oven.

I've had mine for some time now and would not be with out it, but it is best for one or two persons. tip for chips, in a suitable bowl place the chips prior to cooking, poor over a little oil, rape seed oil is best, then stir the chips to fully coat and than put into fryer, this will give a better looking chip with no uncoated dry cooked areas.
Can also be used as a mini oven for small portion cooking like pies and cakes plus casseroles in small dishes, not very good for turkeys though LOL.

this is my third air fryer, my first 2 were morphy Richards and broke after 3 months each. We use this to cook everything. Very handy for a quick healthy meal. For chips I highly recommend using maris piper and soaking them the night before in water, then change the water and dry them before adding a teaspoon of oil and salt.

Great product, used almost exclusively for cooking frozen chips. Takes a bit if experimentation to get the right chips and definitely needs a little bit more oil than recommended but when you do get these variables right the results are excellent. I have knocked a star off because the Philips accessories are an absolutely ridiculous price. Irrelevant if you don't want them of course but I wanted a food separator, just a little metal plate.... £20!!!

Purchased this to replace my actifry as it was on special offer, brilliant far better than the Actifry, chips are browner and take less time to cook, also not so bulky can be kept on Kitchen work surface without looking out of place

This has lasted us well and gets used practically every day.  Everything that needs to be crispy gets cooked in here, I have also cooked chicken pieces etc.  We recommend it to everyone who asks what it is when they spot it in the kitchen and if it ever breaks we would replace it without a minutes thought

I was sceptical to start with that these machine would make good tasting chips; but they do. I would recommend this to anyone who is trying to watch their fat content but still wants chips now and then!
Pros:
- Frozen chips taste just as good as if done in a deep fryer.
- No oil needed at all with frozen chips.
- Better built than the Tefal Actifry. I saw one on show in Curry's about a week before and their version looked looked and felt flimsy and plastic. This is defiantly more durable to 'abuse'.
- Fat frozen chips take about 13 mins (altogether)

How did I ever do without this?  The airfryer has made cooking so much more fun - I can run it alongside my traditional oven and hob for parties (Christmas was a doddle) and fries, breads etc are so much healthier and crisper when prepared in this little gadget.  Throw away / recycle your deep fryer and prepare your french fries with just one teaspoon of oil using this gadget:  your liver, heart and waistline will benefit!

The chips need more attention than those cooked in the Teefal Actifry but come out nice and crisp. it has an alarm that tells you when the cooking is done and more importantly it switches off. Another neat trick is the variable temperature allowing you to cook so many more varieties of food.
It's bigger than I imagined, but it works brilliantly. I'm now using potatoes twice as often as I have done for several years.

It takes twice as long to make chips, but as long as you use the correct potatoes it's even better than deep-fat frying. It recommends Maris Piper, which I have to agree with. They're second only to Golden Wonder in my opinion.
It works best if you coat the chips with a small amount of oil, so it's not totally fat-free - although it can be if you want.
Brilliant product. Wanted one for a while and managed to catch it on a lightning deal. Cooks food perfectly, even from frozen. Capacity is a good size too.
Very easy to use and well built. I have lined the bottom of mine with tin-foil to make cleaning easier and would recommend doing the same.
My only slight issue is that it is a little loud when on due to the fan inside. But seeing as it's only a short amount of time to use it then that's fine.

This will be our 2nd air frier as the first Tefal one we had was not successful with chips. We researched carefully and bought the Phillips. It is great, very good value to start with from Amazon and performs as reviews have stated. We find the thinner chips are more to our liking and I do put a little oil in despite the instructions say it is not needed on pre coated oven chips and I turn a couple of times mid cooking for evenness. The chips are not quite as good as deep fried chips, but not far off and worth compensating that 'nearly as good as' for a so much healthier option. (My husband is a real chip fuss pot and he accepts them!) I have also cooked chicken pieces which came out lovely.

Had this for years now it's a good product still going strong. Barely use the oven since I got this unless I'm making something big eg Lasange that wouldn't fit in here. It needs regular cleaning though or gets very greasy and mucky
Great, only just stated to use it on a nightly basis after 3 years.
That's not to say I didn't use it at all in the past.
The reason is my wife is on a fat free diet and salad, as all us lads know so am I, not thru choice tho.
I have to say I'm pleased with the taste of the food done in it along with my wife so overall a great cooker.

So far so good. This was bought because my overn is broken. It has been used to cook pizza slices (a quarter of a normal sized pizza), frozen chips, spring rolls, chricken drumsticks, potatoes, and crumbed fish fingers. It's a lot quicker than overn since the capacity is much smaller but do pay attention while cooking in case it gets overdone. It's important to shake and check how it goes every few minutes (you don't need to turn it off!).

It does make surprisingly good chips and potato cubes. U can use frozen chips, waffles, alphabites, fritters etc and they come out super yummy. Ive yet to try other foods tho was a bit disappointed that u cant cook sausages in it like u can do with some of the other health fryers.
It washes fairly easy and i like that i can control the temp with this one. I do recommend it for anyone trying to eat more healthily but misses chips.
I also recommend that u buy a chip cutter as the chips do need to be about the same size n thickness to cook at the same time.
Chips taste delicious, sausage, everything I haven't eaten in 20 years tastes good, no fatty upset tummy.
I would recommend leaving chips in water for a couple of hours, lot less starchy.

After reading mixed reviews I was a little nervous about ordering an Airfryer, but after I heard it was half price on Amazon and had a no quibble return with Phillips I decided to try my luck. I'm certainly happy with my fryer so far and have used it about 6 times. We've made meatballs, chicken & chips and all have come out perfect. I think this is going to be replacing the oven for most things (except maybe pizza as I can't think how to fit one of those in the fryer, unless it's a micro-pizza!)
After looking at which n what airfryer i wanted and which would be best for the size of my caravans kitchen I picked this and so far ive cooked every day with the fryer.
Taken some get used to cooking chips and I love them. Only a few sprays of frylight into the airfryer for cooking and lush chips with none of the fat n calories.
Meats never been so good a little seasoning into the fryer and jucie tasty meat comes out! the same goes for chicken and fish.
So easy to clean in the dish washer or just good old fasioned washing up liquid and hot water works just as well.
love this item cook real chips, frozen chips nice and crispy and with no fat. Great for other foods too, swap your deep fat fryer for one of these highly recommend.
just lightly coat chips with oil and use as you would a chip pan, shake about abit and the results are very close better if you ask me as theres no dripping fat.
dishwasher it when needed, its pretty clean most of the time, you wouldnt change the oil in your chip pan every time would you.

Having used a Tefal Actifry for some years I decided to try a different make. Whilst the Philips AirFryer is a lot quicker, 12 minutes as opposed to 40 minutes for the Tefal, it does entail a lot more attention. Because the chips lie on top of each other, the portions that are not exposed to the hot air do not brown. To prevent this, one needs to remove the container after six minutes, give the contents a good shake and cook for six minutes more. I have found that this can still leave sections that are not brown and shake the container twice, once after four and again eight minutes. To improve the flavour, I cut the potatoes into chips, dry them off, and then brush them over with Olive Oil before cooking. It takes a while to get used to, but is a lot easier and cleaner than using a deep fat fryer, and wins over the Tefal Actifry because of the time saving.
BRILLIANT! Use it every day for chips/fry/meat etc! Can throw in anything! :D Very easy to clean aswell.

After much debate wether to get this or a TEFAL actifry i watched a couple of video,s on you tube and we decided on this to be honest it seemed to be quite a bit quieter than the tefal,It arrived quickly tried it out and i must say i was very impressed i love it, and its not just for chips nor is it the gimmicky type of machine that you may think,got some greggs sausage rolls from iceland and this little beuty cooked it to perfection and i do mean perfect, some things take slightly longer than stated but that,s an issue with both machines ,It,s very easy to clean and operate it,s basicly a fan assisted oven and it works brilliant so if you are looking to ditch your chip pan look no further i have had it a while and i think it,s brilliant ,HONESTLY five star hope this helps ,johnm2432.

What a great addition to my kitchen, I hardly use my cooker oven anymore, this air fryer is just so much more convenient and versatile. It can cook almost anything including chips, sausages, bacon in fact any meats! Jacket potatoes and savoury pies are also regulars on my menu!
This is a solid product and the best kitchen appliance we have. Used daily and we make all fried stuff in this so we don’t need to fry. Got used to non fryed food now.
Would be ideal if the grill could be removed separately
Great device for cooking for my 17 year old son. Far better for chips/frozen food/others than my combi-microwave oven.
OK as others have stated it is a mini fan assisted oven, but cooks frozen food and fresh food better and gives a crisp outer to food as does a deep fat fryer.
I have cooked frozen chips/fish/scampi/burgers/chicken without adding oil and all cooked perfectly. Also fresh bacon.
I have cooked fresh fish cakes and fresh chips with a small coating of oil and cooked perfectly.
Experimenting with other food and will update.
Have only been using 1 month on a daily basis at present, so hopefully the 2 year guarantee will see this machine through.

It does what it says and produces healthy chips. They will never be the same as 'chippy' chips but with trial and error one never knows. Easy to produce cook and save cooking oil. So far, easy to clean and no chip pan smells nor large amounts of old cooking oil to dispose of. Just sent for the portable chipper device which arrived in a couple of days now awaiting the tray fixture for cooking steaks, chicken legs, fish etc. Hopefully this can only get better.
This is an excellent appliance. We have used it to cook chips and fish with good results, & are sure that it will have many other cooking uses.

However, I have given it 4 stars because I think that the product description is slightly misleading (although ingenious). It is really a small FAN-OVEN & is not totally 'oil free'. But, because of it's compact size, it is more economical than the large fan oven in our cooker when cooking small amounts.
Brilliant. Really pleased with chips. I like brown chips so leave them cook a bit longer and they come out great.
I do find that the more you shake them the more even the colour. If you just shake them the once I get some white bits, but they are still cooked
No mess no smell easy to clean but if you try moving the chips with a fork they tend to break, so I shake them.  Pan does get hot if you try shaking it using two hands so use an oven glove.
Timer switches the machine off so if you have started doing something else the chips will wait until you are ready for the second cook
Some points to watch for : remember to adjust the cooking temperature for the second cook, you have to cut the chips and soak them for at least 30 mins before cooking but they are worth the wait

My wife swears by this, and finds it best for cooking thin cut chips. So from her point of view it is a success, but for my preference I must admit that traditionally fried chips would be my choice. But this must be healthier.

After some research on airfryers this seemed to be the one to pick for value and performance.  Cooked home made chips with just a fraction of oil so a healthy option.  Looking forward to trying it for other items besides chips but impressed so far.  It is quite large so need to consider space if your kitchen is small.

Worked well for a few months - after a few cleans and some usage this doesn't seem to cook food as well - nice for meat however it leaves chips really dry and they literally feel and taste like cardboard.  I kind of feel like just cooking chips in a deep fat fryer again, it was nicer.

Great product! - bought when on a half price deal and and very happy with he purchase. Used by the whole family i think it was a great investment. We can have homemade chips that use a very minimal amount of oil and still come out looking and tasting great. Easy to clean and look after as well only three parts to it and all easy to clip/slot back into place after use. Is a very easy to sue product, looks stylish and is quiet. If anyone if in the market for an air fryer i would definitely recommend this one.

Buying it in the sale meant l felt it was good value for the money. I wouldn't have paid full price for it.  In hindsight l think l'd have preferred to buy an air fryer that rotates the food for more even cooking. But a bonus with this fact it does not16 rotate means food stays in tact. As long as you periodically remove the basket and give the food a shake to move it around, cooking results are satisfactory. I also found it's trial and error to learn how to cook in it. I used the recipe as guidelines but found my own preferences to temperatures and timings. It's also very easy to clean.
excellent fryer, great price, look no further.

I bought 2 of this for my friends. They are keen into a worl of healthier food with free oil. One of them tried with a chips using the manual. The chips were crunchy but a little burnt. She said she needs to experiment with time so that it turns out good in future.
Overall, this is a good start for those who wants to have a healthier way of fried food

I bought this at the full price but I have not been disappointed at all-it is really a small oven-so usually I find most food frozen or fresh needs half the time it says on the instructions-like everything keep an eye on it-the best chips are to par boil them for 5 mins and deep fry (Waitrose do a tiny deep fryer) or hand stir with a little oil and the air fryer will finish and best of all if you do a double lot and leave the non eaten portion in the fridge for later they have enough oil on them to do again later-joy- It even fluffs (cooks) a puff pastry on top of a pie-am getting another for my holiday home in Ireland as quick and easy -  leaves more Guinness time ! I would add that for a single household person as I am this is a Boon because you do not have to heat even small an oven for 20 minutes and then cook for another 20 minutes -this will pre-heat in 3 and do it all in half the time on the label

I love this item and it makes fantastic chips, i haven't tried anything else yet. I was looking to use the divider one day but saw it was not included, i got in touch with Amazon who were fantastic as usual and told me they had a prompt on the screen for me to contact philips. I did and was told by philips this version did not contain the divider and they have had a few queries and need to make this clearer for customers.  If i had known i may have paid more for the one with the divider for future baking. Still pleased with the product though.
Only goes up to 200 degrees.  Food takes at least twice the time that they say to cook.  If I had known what I know now I would not have bought it
Delivered quick.

Previously had an actifry but the paddle started to mush everything up so stopped using it.  This is fab - no paddle just hot air which cooks in half the time that it would take in the oven.  Only really used it for fresh chips, frozen oven chips, chicken nuggets and fish fingers and cooked everything fabulously - nice crispy chips and the real chips only need ½ tbsp. of oil.  Can't recommend enough although it is quite expensive and I only really use it a couple of times a week so a bit of an extravagance but who cares - love it.

We used it a couple of times to bake chips. However it didn't made crunch chips but just cooked. It does only need a small amount of oil to cook them. I will try to explore a bit more about this fryer in the future with other food. It's very easy to use and can be cleaned in the washing machine.
Excellent, great chips within 20 minutes. can do fresh or oven chips. Oven chips come out far nicer than from an oven. Would not be without as safe for kids to use.
Unless you're feeding huge numbers, this could do a lot of the work you get your oven to do, without burning 10p to preheat the cavity.

It's a bit pokey if you're into batch baking but for everyday things - and I'd rather not mention ovenchips - this countertop hot air oven will cut 25% off most cooking times - and, it follows, your electricity bill.
Forget baking off with Mel'n'Sue, just pour yourself a drink, tip the bag into the basket. Turn the dial and pretty soon you'll be eating.
You can cook fresh foods in it, too. They tell me.
Brilliant machine, this is our second one and would higlhly recommend it
I cook everything in it chips, sausages, fish, to yorkshire
Tasty and not fatty

I'm impressed. I was a bit sceptical but thought I would give it a try. Chips and roasters are brilliant, cooked chops lovely and warmed pies like a proper oven - crispy pastry not soggy like microwave. Chicken wings fantastic. Another thing it cooks so fast! Definitely recommend this.

I can confirm once you buy this you will use it all the time unlike many kitchen gadgets.  Not only is it more healthy but it actually cooks some things better than other methods!  It is also handy when running out of hobs or oven space.  It can extend the amount of items cooking at the same time.  Really happy.  My 14yr old loves using it to.

I like this air fryer, but I always seem to have a problem with the chips sticking to the basket. Have no idea why. I end up spending an age after trying to get them out and clean the basket. They always end up all mushy. Haven't tried anything else in it yet. OK. But really annoying that they stick and yes I do shake them throughout cooking.

Really surprised how quick this is. Items are not sitting in fat while cooking. Not using my oven much at all now. Cooks sausages  great, no need to turn them, cooks evenly all round. Still experimenting on what I can cook in there.
Only downer is there is not divider to the basket. Would be nice to have one to use when you want.

Ok not as good as fried chips but a lot more healthy. Bit of a fiddle to clean you have to clean it well as the tray gets clogged with congealed fat yuk! Very expensive for what is essentially a double sided grill. If it was cheaper it would have had a better review but it's overprced
Bought this for my wife who is on the Slimming world regime
It is a Fantastic we now have abandoned the oven for making healthy chips, baked potatoes or anything else you would put in there.
If you use Fry Light rather than Oil on the chips when cooking you get great results and they are FREE on Slimming world.
Revolutionised healthy food in the house

This machine has changed my life!! I am a big fan of chips but never have them for health reasons, well worry no more with this wonderful machine!!! Quick and easy and you can put the tray and basket in the dishwasher, which is great.  I have found that cooking the chips twice is best, so if you have time, do them for 10 mins before you are due to eat.  Then 10mins before you are serving up, put them on for another 10mins then you will have perfect chips!  I also recommend using the packets of potato wedge flavourings, just add half a teaspoon of the seasoning when you are using your spray oil or olive oil before you put them in.  Perfect!  Best price around was from Amazon.  I highly recommend this product.
first time use and its smoking very bad, keeps on smoking enough to set of my smoke alarms and im only cooking breaded chicken in it

Someone recommended this to me so I was on the lookout for a decent deal on this model. I wanted a compact air fryer that was quite easy to use with no fussing around with oils, trays, and light weight. When Amazon offered this at half price I bit the bullet and ordered one. It arrived quickly and that evening I thought I would try it out. I was not disappointed... Very easy to use and made the most delicious sweet potato fries within minutes. The kids gobbled them up so I had to make new batch so as to have a few myself.
Great unit, easy to use, simple to store!!

Saw this on TV and so we bought one. We expected to be able to throw the deep fat drier away, so we did. BIG mistake! After a few attempts cooking chips in the AirFryer we went out and bought another deep fat fryer. Do not buy this if you only intend frying chips, its next to useless, it cooks them but they taste awful. What it is good at is frying sausages and other items, fish fingers are another food it cooks well, trouble is you need this to cook the fish fingers and a deep fat fryer for the chips!
Makes baked spuds in 25 minutes.  What's not to love?

Excellent bit.of kit don't know why I didn't buy one sooner my wife wasn't pleased when I bought it however now she couldn't  be without one our ,meals cooked to perfection, in double quick time and no fat unbelievable  ,i would highly recommended this product

Found this item very useful.  Ideal for roast potatoes, toasted sandwiches, crumbles and small Yorkshire puddings  Anything that goes in the main oven will cook adequately in the Airfryer.  Found tin-foil cases to be most useful to cook in as it if difficult getting ovenware small enough for the Airfryer,  Would thoroughly recommend this item.
Love this what a great buy! I would definitely recommend buying it! Was packed well and came in the post quick.
I use mine ALL the time absolutely brilliant.

A good product but it does have a couple of minor flaws. The temperature setting dial would be better if it clicked on the different settings. Also the mains lead is a bit short. Now for cooking its excellent although you may need to "experiment" if you use proper potatoes to make chips instead of using oven chips as the results can vary depending on thetype of potato used.
I recommended this fryer to friends and bought one for my son as I was so pleased with it. However a few short months on I have been extremely disappointed to find the the coat

On the inside of basket has started to peel off,  As  a Vegan I only use it to cook veg and I follow the care instructions. I hope that the people I have recommended this to do not have the same problem as I will no longer be recommending this product, I am so disappointed.

We've used it for many things now including roast potatoes, roast veg, oven roasted chips, and even a "banana fritter" cake, and each time the result is very good.  It's excellent if like us you have an electric oven from the 1980s which will not heat up properly!  Really recommend this product.

The only down as some other reviewers have mentioned is its size, mainly height, but if you can adjust a shelf in the kitchen for it, it does fit in a standard cupboard too - just move the handle out of the way
As the container is dishwasher safe, this is also good for easy care maintenance
Could not get on with this product
This product was a great idea. Used it for a whilte but gavbe up as we are visually impaired and were told that the steam from it marked the ceiling.

Very pleased with the air fryer. It arrived very quickly after ordering & of course I tried the chips, they were great, at last non greasy chips!! Recently tried the chicken recipe in the booklet, substituted legs for breasts cut in half, delicious. Would recommend.

I expected more...the food is relatively dry and difficult to chew. Fries are ok the first five 5 minute, but after that they become dry and gummi like...not impressed ( I ordered 3 of them- one for me and 2 for Christmas presents)
Very good. Always cook my chips in this and I use a spray oil. My chips come crispy but not like the deep fat fryer. Not to everyone taste but suits me.
Love it! Does amazing chips (if you follow the guidelines​ and soak first to de-starch them), roast potatoes, char-grilled vegetables. Oven ships are superb, so crisp and crunchie!.
Great for re-heating Aint Bessie's Yorkshire Puddings - (2 minutes at 200°C)

Not nearly as good as I thought. It only dies really small positions, 4 bits of chicken and you can't do chicken and chips together. Only enough chips for 2 /3 people at at push. The house did smell, as did my clothes afterwards. ~No one could tell between the chicken I cooked in the oven and the chicken I cooked in here. I really wouldn't bother.
Exactly what it says it is an airfryer
Basically this does the job of an oven, but with a super strong fan setting
Result: much better than oven quality fries, nuggets, etc however, doesnt beat the real thing (deep fried in oil), healthier alternative

Cleaning the machine after use is a bit of a hassle. The mesh wire net seems to trap crumbs etc, and the fibres on dishwashing sponge keeps getting stuck on the mesh wire net. Be careful not to use anything abrasive so as not to damage the non-stick coating.
Other than that straightforward cleaning so 4 stars for this item.
Try cooking chips and tossing some cheese in 1 minute before its done. Easy and perfect chips and cheese!
Recommend this as I live on my own and perfect for cooking small amounts of food
Love this product. Especially good for cooking with little or no oil
The wife is fed up with me not giving reviews. But this is amazing, I can do sausages, chicken etc. We use fry light, to do slimming world chips etc. Easy to keep clean, cooks very fast.
She cant live with out it
This is fantastic wish I’d got one ages ago, do so much in it , breakfast lunch and tea. Easy to use and clean

I am not happy with the product after trying with a variety of foods.
Is the wired basket supposed to be non stick coated?

I have tried with salmon and the outcome was bad. The very first time i didn't add any oil so with the second try, i sprayed the salmon with some oil and yet the outcome was the same. And since that happened, it took me forever to clean the basket, even though i did soaked it in hot soapy water for a good few hours. Please advise what to do?
Read all the reviews before buying this. I have to watch what I eat for medical reasons.

It arrived next day via CityLink & I expected it to be really heavy, but I guess that is relative & it was really easy to handle. The trick with the packaging is to cut the fastening tape, carefully invert the fryer then slide off the packing. Moving heavy object from packing is the wrong way round. Years of unpacking computers has taught me this.

In use, for us as a couple it is great & very much a case of experimentation with different potatoes, wedges, chips, oils & flavourings-you can't 'set it & forget it' like a 'normal' fryer. However, the results are absolutely great-the best chips & wedges we've ever tasted-the fish & chip recipe from the recipe booklet is great & our Friday night treat. We've also tried halved tomatoes & oil-brushed mushrooms for a low-fat accompaniment. When we do chips or wedges for 4 & the pan is full that takes more care & more time & for a large family needing bigger quantities I would imagine the fryer could be quite frustrating.
In conclusion, this is a great bit of kit (easy to clean in dishwasher or hot, soapy soak) and we've eaten more chips & wedges this year than the past 5 years-healthy & great flavours.

I purchased this because I'm trying to keep my cholesterol down and I do have a passion for fried food. This is a sort of device that you can't take straight out of the box and expect first class result first time. There are so many variables with cooking different foods that it does require experimentation and patience to get the results you require.

My first batch of chips was a disaster; I had the temperature wrong and forgot to give them a shake half way through but I did eat them. After a little experimentation, I can now cook reasonably good chips; you really must give them a shake after every 3-4 minutes to get a good even cook. Despite the manufacturers contrary comments regarding cooking sausages, I find that they cook quite well without the white smoke that Philips claim will emit from the fryer (as a Muslim, I only cook halal sausages which contain a lot less fat than the normal ones).

The only food (and it is not mentioned anywhere in the manual) that does emit white smoke is frozen battered fish portions; 12 minutes at 200 degrees and they're cooked to a treat. Chicken nuggets, fish cakes, fish fingers, they all cook very well in this fryer. To sum it up, I am very pleased with the results I get from it and I can eat more knowing that the saturated fat is reduced by at least 80%.
A good buy and a good product. The only hassle is have to wash it out after each use, but it doesn't take that long and it's a lot easier that cleaning a deep fat fryer. Highly recommended.
Bought this as a replacement for my old deep fat fryer which I was all too happy to junk.
I chose this as an alternative to the Tefal actifry and I'm happy I did.
1. Takes up about the same space as my old fryer.
2. Doesn't produce smells that last for hours unlike the old fryer.

3. No waste oil to change every so often (though as expected you still have to use some on your food to help it cook), this makes this very environmentally friendly as your not having to dispose of gallons of waste oil per year into landfill.
4. Significantly reduces the amount of oil used to cook things, which is alot healthier option.

This is a truly excellent piece of kit! It cooks quickly and very evenly, so long as you shake the basket (as per manufacturer instructions)- only a brief shake a couple of times - no pancake style flipping is necessary! I have not found it difficult to relocate the basket either into its holder or into the body of the machine, it's just a knack to learn. The price is VERY variable, so it's well worth spending time checking various outlets/sites; I saved nearly 40%. I would definitely advise buying the version that comes with the baking accessory as I'm having difficulty sourcing it separately from Philips (the website constantly says 'out of stock' though they have reduced its price for the January sales - you just can't actually buy it!)

I have no hesitation in recommending the airfryer, both for baking from fresh or frozen, the food retains its moisture and doesn't go hard compared to oven baking and it genuinely scarcely needs oil to give the fried effect. My family are fussy eaters, but are completely in agreement about the excellence of this gadget. As it is not too large (easily fitting under my upper kitchen units) I'm actually considering buying a SECOND one (with the baking accessory included!) as it is only large enough to cook four portions of anything at once. The divider works well for cooking protein one side and veg the other, but really only enough to feed two people (unless you are much stronger willed than we are at resisting delicious food.) I've found it particularly useful for producing puddings without having to be nipping in and out of the kitchen during a meal, as it cooks so quickly that starting it at the same time as clearing main course plates has allowed me to spend more time enjoying the meal, too.

Be aware, the black version is a large chunk of solid black and does look rather like Darth Vader's helmet - and indeed makes a not dissimilar noise - so if you have a very light and bright kitchen, you may well prefer the white version. My advice is BUY IT! BUY IT!
very fast delivery , have tried out product for a day or two now,
never again will we go back to the deep fat fryers ,
this is a beautiful machine ,it does as it says on the box,
little tip ,par boil your  potatoes for a miute or two,
dry off ,coat lightly in olive oil , BEST ROAST POTATOES EVER
no fat grease , very dry & fluffy ,easy to clean ,more or less a two minute job,
was a bit dubious at first new fangled machine that end up in the cupboard,

What an ingenious piece of equipment.  I have not had the fryer for too long, but what I have cooked in it so far, has not been a disappointment.  All those lovely "fatty" treats like chips, I can now have, and not feel as guilty as I used to.  What I love about it, is there is no lingering smell of greasy oil in every room.  Just a quick wash and it is ready for the next delightful dish you want to cook.  Chicken is especially good.  Well worth purchasing.

I always research a product before I buy and I go on more than one site to read reviews from online magazines, which reports, Amazon customers, Argos etc., I chose this over the acti-fry which is currently very popular but did not meet my personal criteria.

This product did not fail my expectations. The nice thing about this fryer is that the kitchen doesn't steam up like ordinary electric fryers, the food was perfectly cooked, tastier and not greasy. Although the tray doesn't look very big, we all ate a decent portion of chips and there are 4 of us (adults).
Cleaning the tray was a breeze, the instructions say it is suitable for the dishwasher, but it was so easy to clean I washed it by hand in seconds.
I can't believe we waited so long to buy one! Guilt free food, cooked to perfection, tasty, no mess, clean kitchen! Love it :)
The best thing I ever had , the attached photo is air fried vegetables

I bought this on a whim. Having been brought up on good old Scottish meals like "Glasgow salad" aka mince pie, chips and beans... I still love eating chips and other fried foods, but as I get older I see the value in at least trying to eat more healthily. But who really likes rabbit food and smaller portions than the kids get?
Aye, this really does combine the best of both worlds! Who would have ever believed in healthier fried foods that taste just as great, without all the grease!?
And... not only is the air fryer easy to clean, but so is your plates & cutlery.
Buy it... if you really like your fried foods.

This air fryer is excellent, however it appears to have a inherent fault in the basket draw lower seal material as after a few months the seal fails, and a replacement appears to be unavailable, and Philips will not send a replacement draw outside of the UK.
However AMAZON came to the rescue and replaced the whole unit, after being informed of Philips refusal to send spare abroad.

My previous deep fat fryer broke down so I decided to go for this oil-free option and have been pleased with my decision.  I have so far only used frozen chips and have  experimented with and without oil.  The preference so far has been to use a desertspoon of sunflower oil and cook for 6 minutes,  remove from fryer shake and then cook for a further 6 minutes. This has been satisfactory.  I intend to try from fresh potatoes but haven't done so so far.  I  am much happier with this oil-free option - not only from the  health aspect but  this is  much safer to have in the home.  The chips are different from those cooked in deep fat  oil but very nice - don't feel you want so  many, which is a good thing.  I am pleased with the fryer.

Delivered on time, no damage and well packaged in the product's original box. Used it for the first time this evening, made marinated chicken drumsticks and French fries. I must say that I was sceptical about the quality of the food cooked in this way. No more. I first did the chicken for 20 minutes (15 would've been fine too). Perfect is a big word, so I leave it in amazing. Crispy skin and juicy; thoroughly cooked inside. Zero greasiness. The chips in 15 minutes were simply perfect. Better than fried with oil, %100. Crunchy, golden outside and soft and fluffy inside. The only downside is the size of the basket. Is early days yet, but I almost wish I had bought a model with a bigger basket now. Compared to frying the same meal the traditional way, is like comparing the performance of a Ferrari against a push bike. It took less than 40 minutes to have perfectly cooked Chicken and Chips for two people. No smoke, oil-spitting, hardly any smell. Easy to wash and store away. It is also very safe and even kids could use it safely with a little supervision. I think this model is great for people living alone and couples, mostly because of size of basket. I didn't think you could have clean-tasting, delicious fried food without oil, but there it is. So far I can only say good things and strongly recommend this product... is worth it just for the perfect chips!!
I read all the other reviews and found most were favourable - just one man said he couldn't make good crispy brown chips - GUESS HE NEVER READ THE INSTRUCTIONS, EH!

* WELL ALL I CAN SAY IS IT MAKES ABSOLUTELY 'FANTASTIC' CHIPS; WE USE CRINKLY OVEN CHIPS FROM OUR SUPERMARKET - STRAIGHT OUT OF THE FREEZER AND INTO THE AIR FRYER.  12 - 14 MINS LATER THEY ARE SUPER (GIVE EM A SHAKE ABOUT HALF WAY THROUGH).  MY GRAN LOVES THEM, SO DO THE REST OF US.  MAKES SUPER FISH AND FISH FINGERS TOO.  Will have to get one of the 'extra' baking dishes to go in the fryer in order to try other things, but VERY HAPPY SO FAR.  GREAT PRODUCT AND HAPPY TO RECOMMEND IT.

I dont normally do reviews but on this product I just had to.  I got this at half price so a bargain!!.  We have used it every day since we have had it.  Chicken nuggets for the kids are great, chips (frozen ones)are so crispy and fluffy inside. Onion rings are lovely. Chicken Breast coated in your favourite coating is so easy!. The best thing we find with this is the kids can use it.  It like a microwave to them.  If the lad wants a fishfinger sandwich then he just chucks them in a turns it on and waits for the ding!  At least we know now he wont be messing with the gas oven which obviously is a lot more dangerous and probably more expensive to run!.
when finished put the stuff in dishwasher
A great product!  Get one now

I've waited a few weeks since buying this fryer so I could give a proper review. And I'm happy to give it five stars. My wife, who's always on a diet, wanted this so she could make chips using less fat and she's also the one who uses it. So far she's made a few servings of chips, some roast potato's and spicy chicken. All of which have been delicious. There's also less cooking smell afterwards. My better half says it takes about 20 minutes to cook chips and they come out golden brown and crunchy. Assuming it doesn't pack up prematurely, I'd say this was a great buy. Oh another reason for choosing this model was because its small enough to fit inside a cupboard rather than using valuable worktop space. Its plenty big enough for two but if you're feeding a family I'd go for the bigger model. Highly recommended.

Well should I buy this or not ? .....my goodness we are so glad I did , it's absolutely great . Ok the chips are maybe dryer than some would like but it's up to you how much oil you sprinkle on , we just sort of smear  our clean hands with a small amount and rub over the chips ......just perfect every time , and how we like them , takes about 10 minutes, remembering to shake them now and again so they don't stick. The Fryer is so easy to clean , have cooked chicken breasts and a apple cake , both came out fine too . It is the cheapest from Amazon who I love to buy from as their back up if ever need is just first class. It arrived very quickly too . It's not a huge contraption but fits nicely in the corner of my kitchen . It cooks me and hubby enough chips , but I suppose you could put more in for required . It does jacket potatoes great too taking about 30 to 40 minutes depending on size of potatoes . I have put 4 in when we have company ,a reasonable size too as they filled the basket . I have said whenever we go on holiday I'm taking it with me! The only downside is my big main oven as got the sulks it's become redundant !!!!

Have had this item for quite a while now and it is not stuck at the back of a cupboard unloved and rarely used.  Had a few teething problems to begin with, not using enough oil (anyone who can get away with 1 spoonful obviously has no taste buds) chips not cooking in middle and hard and inedible, potato stuck to bottom of basket like cement!!  However after reading other peoples reviews I have it sussed now I parboil the potatoes, then put some oil in a tray and shake the chips in it till coated and I put a small piece of tinfoil in bottom of basket until chips begin to cook then it can be removed, the result is the most wonderful home cooked chips and wedges (skin on) and oven chips are amazing (especially Asda Leith school of food type).  The fryer is used at least once a week and we have not been near a chip shop since!! Highly recommend.

the recipe guides before you buy this product.  You have to prepare the chips hours in advance of actually cooking them (if using fresh) - you have to soak and dry the potatoes well in advance of wanting to cook them - so if you just fancy a bowl of chips one evening - you have to plan about an hour in advance.  On the upside, i really did use a teaspoon of oil and they were absolutly delicious helathy chips that come out.

well made and works well. does things like chicken drumsticks and many more, but does not do chips as good as fried chips, after saying that I still think they are not too bad and cooking is quick with no fuss. plenty space needed for storage. all in all, we like it

I've owned one of these for one and a half years and it has worked perfectly without problems.  It has seen a lot of use.
It always makes the best chips I've ever had at home (better than most restaurants too) and of course they are low in fat as well.
Taste, texture, moisture and crispiness are all spot on.  Whether you make skinny French fries, fat wedge type chips with skin on, or everything in between, the results are superb.
I suggest that if you follow the instructions your chips will be absolutely lovely, whether you use oven chips from the supermarket or chop your own potatoes.
I cannot understand any reviews that suggest the chips are poor and can only assume that these reviewers have not used the unit correctly...

I had a tefal airfryer for 2 years , but the paddle broke, so after debating for quite a while, I decided to go for the the philips ..so pleased I did! love it! I much prefer a machine without a Paddle, doesn't knock breadcrumbs off my Scotch eggs or breadcrumb chicken, also I've tried the recipe for the ricotta cheese cake, and strawberry muffins, both turned out really well. Love the look of it,  very sleek and looks smart on the kitchen worktop. Have done the usual chips both from potatoes and frozen frying chips. Both good..did frozen roast potatoes and parsnips last night for quick meal to go with sausage and onion gravy. Meaning never had to turn on the oven . And both turned out super crispy with fluffy centers. Great machine. Half the noise of the tefal. If thinking of getting one. Do it now. You won't regret it .

I bought this after watching Stephen Fry use one on a cookery programme. It does what it says on the tin--fries food with just a drop of oil. I can't eat oven ready chips (heaven knows what they coat them with but they all cause me to have stomach upsets), so this machine was the answer.I also 'fry' other foods eg meat/veg. It's quick and economical, using hardly any power. It's also easy to clean. It makes a bit of a noise when in use but not so much that you can't watch TV and/or listen to the radio at the same time.
Very good product.

I was so happy I've found the perfect solution for frying chips and other food. It sounded promising, healthy, easy to use and it was kind of easy. But soon after it started to work, the awful smell of burning plastic filled the whole house. And the chips tasted and smelled of burned plastic. Really strong. Washing and repeating the process didn't help at all, Having wasted three meals it was the time to send it back.
It's a huge disappointment as the place for any fryer in the kitchen is empty now. It was sad and maybe even traumatic experience, especially for the kids.
We've got the refund.

We were fed up with oven chips, but didn't want to go to the unhealthy option of a deep fat fryer. I stumbled upon this by accident and can't rate it highly enough. So far we have only really used it for chips and variations of roast potatoes, but we are all really impressed with them. I only use such a small amount of oil and a sprinkling of salt and the result is perfect tasting chips, and in one basket we can cook enough for four adult portions. Looking forward to trying lots of other things in it.

Fryer works well, but you need to learn how it should work for you. Although the book that comes with it has some guide lines you really need to adapt those times and temperature to your needs. Suggest that you check the food more than once during frying time and start with lower temperature to then have final minutes at a higher one. It really does the trick and my children said that their fries tasted like the McDonalds ones so it seems to work!

Although read about its size before buying it i was still surprised when i took it out, it's not small but i have to say it does look well manufactured. It is a little bit noisy but I have other kitchen cooking appliances that make more noise so it's not too bad.

I will probably buy it again although next time i might go for the higher one as depends how many people you need to feed the basket for the food might be a bit too small. Currently OK for 2 adults and 4 kids but i'll certainly need to use it twice when they are teenagers!
This is a great and very useful product.
you can fry/bake basically anything in it. It saves times compared with using an oven for anything frozen. Makes frozen french fries actually tasty! 0 effort.
Cleaning is also very easy - just wipe off a drop of oil left behind by whatever it is you were preparing and give the mesh a wipe.
My only two negatives here are:
its size is a bit on the small side (and were only 2 people in the household!), though that makes it easier to store.
the accessories available (baking tin, divider) are expensive (about a fifth of the price of the actual fryer!)

I have been actually considering buying another one to solve the size issue. One fryer is enough if part of the planned meal is fried - if you have to fry more than one thing (chips/french fries/wedges + breaded scampi/burger/fried chicken breast) you'd have to put then in one after the other and try to keep everything warm before serving. I would definitely say if you have more than two people to feed, one air fryer will not cut it, from my experience.

The Philips Airfryer arrived on time and well packaged. I was impressed by its looks - it's sleek and functional and looks pretty good on the kitchen counter. The retractable wire was an added bonus. The instructions are extremely easy to follow so much so that I was already cooking chips a few minutes after unpacking it. I chose this model since the basket is large enough to cook for two to three persons. Results were great at the first try - chips and roast potatoes came out perfectly golden brown, crunchy on the outside but fluffy in the centre. The chicken drumsticks came out a dream, retaining all the lovely juices. I managed to fit a small chicken which turned out better than the ready-roasted ones you get in supermarkets. I've used it for baking pies, cakes, cordon bleu, springrolls, pre-baked breads...the results were consistently good. Cleaning it was just as easy. Worth every penny!

I use this almost everyday. I makes the best chips ever and baked potatoes are wonderful. I am a member of slimming world and this machine makes it so easy to stick to a healthy diet. Just about anything can be air fried. The only downside is that its not large enough if your cooking for more than two people
What a great product: easy to put together and even easier to work.

I didn't have one small enough. So was disappointed that I couldn't start to use it. You need an ovenware dish of if round 20cm or square 19x19 cm on outer edges no more than 8cm deep. It does state this in the booklet that comes with the air fryer but if your like me I tend to not read everything. Once brought the dishes the food was excellent very tasty. Would recommend to everyone. Have spoken to other people who say they just put the food directly in the fryer without the basket I did try this but found it a little messy. But it did work.

What a fabulous product. Frozen chips have never tasted this good before we had the Airfryer. The only reason I would still put chips in the oven is if it were going to be on anyway. Jacket potatoes are brilliant, lovely crisp skins and so soft in the middle. Only thing I would say,start the jackets off in the microwave for a few minutes then transfer to the Air fryer, we found they took an awfully long time to cook solely in the Airfryer. The airfryer looks good too and we haven't noticed finger marks as I thought we might being shiny black. We're a family of three, me husband and 4 year old. This is what I've cooked:
3 pieces of salmon fillets, if heavily marinated and drip, I'll place a pice of foil under each, still cook gorgeous
Roast potatoe wedges (either home made or bought, depends on how tired I'm feeling)

Fishcakes, bean burgers, homemade meat burgers or standard shop ones, fish pieces, fish fingers, all take about 10-15 mins (I pop them in when I get home and they're ready when I'm done getting changed)

I adore this Airfryer and no longer deep fry anything.  I was a little hesitant as a lot of people say it is just an oven, but I can tell you it makes amazing food that tastes like its deep fried with a fraction of the fat.

I have made roast chicken (cut down as this size will not fit a whole one) and it is succulent with a beautifully crispy skin. If you are interested in making your own, I used an  Arancinotto which I purchased from Amazon in Italy, but it is now available on the Amazon U.K. Site, I'm planning on buying the round version next.
I bought this after refusing to buy a deep fat fryer then nearly setting the kitchen on fire using a saucepan

They say that if something stays on the kitchen worktop, it must be useful. Well this has never been in the cupboard and we use it regularly. I don't bother making roast potatoes in the oven any more as they are fantastic done in the air fryer and frozen chips are done in a matter of a few minutes. I admit that it is used for what would have gone in a DFF but it has never failed to produce a better result and in less time
i have not tried it for cakes etc, but if I never do that, it will still be worth the money

We've had this device for around 3 years, gets used on average once or twice a month. Performance, once you get the hang of it is good, making decent chips and potato wedges (wedges are better) albeit not very quickly. We've been more than happy with it's use.

I wached the video that is shown with this product,and it shows you a basket divider??. when I opened the box there wasn't one,so I looked at the product description and it says the one I bought doesn't have one (HD9220 ).where does it say this in the product selling description. does anyone know where I can buy one of the basket dividers ??.

Very pleased with my purchase. I find 20mins to do a family of 4 gives you great chips, always give a couple of shakes to the basket and to get them evenly brown. I don't use any oil. Great value from Amazon

I am really pleased with this item, it has cooked perfect chips I no longer need to buy frozen packs of oven chips.
It also makes perfect roast vegetables, I have still to cook spicy wedges but I do not see a problem the instructions are clear enough.
