When I was briefly living with my parents, I couldn't help but notice that this was the most used gadget in the kitchen (out of countless numbers my mother has bought over the years). My mother has been using hers religiously for the best part of 2 years.
I am not one to be easily impressed, however when I moved into my own flat, I bought one, and I use it every night.

I bought my first Philips Airfryer four years ago and it has worked perfectly and become the most used item in our kitchen. Ignore the reviews that compare it to a deep fat fryer - it is not a replacement, and the name kind of sets it up for a fall really! This is basically a small fan-assisted oven that gets to temperature in three minutes. In doing so, it saves a lot of time and electricity, and we rarely use our main oven anymore. It's particularly good for making crunchy jacket potatoes - just turn the temp to max, rinse your potatoes in cold water, sprinkle them with salt, and cook for 40 or so minutes depending on the size (you will need to turn the timer again as its max is 30 mins). Oven chips come out really well and are done in 15 minutes with a shake halfway through, and it's suitable for everything from cooking sausages to heating pies, even toasting bread. Because the hot air circulates so ferociously, it also makes the best roast potatoes, just make sure they get a good bit of oil before you put them in. You can obviously spray a drop of oil on anything you wish to cook once it's inside, but I tend to find that you can only get to the top area easily. If you plan to heat Quiches or anything with a delicate top, either cover it or turn the heat down and cook it for longer. The source of the heat is the equivalent of a kettle's thermostat with a fan behind it, so it is possible to burn things if you're not used to it. At the current price, this is great value - I paid £160 for my original one four years ago. It only has two controls so it's easy to use, it's easy to clean, and overall it's been an excellent purchase. Just don't expect it to replace your deep fat fryer like for like!

This is probably the best new kitchen product I have bought for years. I thought it would cook sauteed and fried potatoes adequately and the odd chop or sausage. In reality the airfryer is awesome. It does all this brilliantly and in a fraction of the time, but it does so, so much more. In a small kitchen it will be a little noisy but cooking smells are at a minimum and  the results are just wonderful. I have used it so much it will eventually wear out (I guess) and when it does a new one will be on order immediately.  If you love food but hate fat and hot oil, buy one - you won't regret it

as the title says we try and eat healthily and avoid foodstuffs that arent too good for us like chips, however this item does great chips from thins, fats, wedges and all without deep frying in fat. very pleased so far but havent got round to many of the more detailed recipe suggestions.

Well we've had this a month now and have to say once you get used to cooking times the chips come out golden, crisp on the outside and soft inside .. 1st batch were over cooked and the were like sticks just shattered when stabbed with a fork, by batch number 3 great.  Best option mccain big bag half a basket for 12 minutes shake then a further 8 minutes, if you like fries 6mins shake and 6 mins more, if you prefer steak chips fresh from potatoes then 10 mins shake and 8 minutes
I bought this when my deep fat fryer died.  It has been a great decision.  Not only are oven chips tastier, when you get the hang of it, home-made chips can be good and far healthier.

I'm not sure I agree that the home-made chips taste better, but if you're trying to cut down on fat (aren't we all?) then the air fryer is for you.  Don't forget to soak your chips for a minimum of 30 minutes before cooking.
The lack of smell of hot oil after cooking and the ease of cleaning are a big bonus.

My Air fryer is the most useful item of kitchen equipment that I have purchased for some time. Besides being competitively priced, it works brilliantly. Very quick to heat up and easy to use.  So far I have cooked sausages, bacon  chicken portions, small cakes, bread rolls etc. All cooks evenly and quickly. Fresh or frozen chips are delicious as also are mixed veg. Any excess oil on food just drips to the base, so the food does not sit in oil if you have used too much. Simple to clean either by hand or dishwasher. Great addition to my kitchen

This was purchased as a replacement for our Actifry which had more or less dropped apart due to overuse.  I love it, it is more flexible than the Actifry in that it does not break up delicate food, though I did manage to cook samosas in the Actifry.  I must confess to slipping into the same rut as I did with the aforementioned Actifry by only cooking potatoes but it does do wonderful jacket potatoes and chips and any of the other processed potato products that are on the market.  It also reheats pies very well but so far have not tried cooking one from the raw state.  It makes wonderful Southern Fried Chicken and the pineapple recipe (if you like pineapple and coconut) in the recipe book that accompanies it, is to die for.

not quite sure yet, must find more things to do with it, have done oven chips ( not a big lover of them ) passable have warmed bread rolles good put a crispy top on 2 day old rolls. will keep trying though. yours chris cross.

After several attempts to cook chips, all unsuccessful, we returned the AirFryer. Despite following the recommended method, to the letter, and shaking and turning the chips every five minutes, and then every three minutes, the result was undercooked centres and burnt edges. Chicken took far longer than the recommended time and, just like the chips, cooked unevenly.
We were glad that we had purchased from Amazon as return, and a full refund, were handled without quibbling. We have now bought a deep fat fryer and are enjoying real French fries again.
Was a present for my parents. Didn't expect the unit to be so large and the cooking compartment to be so small!

However...There was no food separator in the box. Spoke to Amazon, hoping and they send out just the missing part -but no, they sent a whole new unit out to me. So I had to go through the inconvenience of sending the original unit back.
The replacement unit also didn't have a food separator!
Asked for a refund.

It does what it says but it is limited according to literature. However I think you can do lots more with a little creativity for example, using the empty pie tine (Fray Bentos) can do sausages and roast tatties. Will do more

Yes I know the title sounds lame but it's true! In the past I would have fired up the oven as an expensive way to cook chips/onion rings/baked potatoes that would have taken longer, cost more to cook and not come out as good.
Now I use this little beauty, it's quicker, more cost efficient and the food is cooked better!

I'm really impressed by this unit. Yes you can use your oven. But this is designed to cook chips and other small items, it's not a generalist device. And it works. All with a half-teaspoon of oil. So chips come out healthy and crunch and yummy.
My wife and I are both dieting so it's nice to be able to have the option for chips without having the penalty of all that unhealthy oil.
Thoroughly recommend this product.

The only issue I have is unlike the tefal one this will not stir for you. Do you have to take the basket out and give it a goo shake a few times during the cooking process. With skinny chips it's better to use a spoon as well so you can really separate them out.

Have used several times now and all is very good. Wonderful 'dry' chips - perfectly cooked. I use 1cal oil lightly sprayed on then rubbed in with hands. Soaking for 30 mins in cold water and drying before oiling also helps. The noise level is quite quiet for a machine with a fan - less than I would expect. Not tried other recipes yet. It is quite a big unit so will live on the top of my cabinets in a dust cover but what do you expect if you want to cook a decent portion?!

My only grouse is that the accessories for grilling steaks etc are stupidly expensive for what they are so I will not be buying these unless they are in a reduced offer in the future. Lots of products do this high pricing on the 'extras' so they are no different, but it is a stupid policy of manufacturers.

This really is not a good machine, it's a shame because it looks really stylish and has a smaller footprint than the activity but it really doesn't make good chips, which for me was the main purpose in buying it.

I looked around the net and this seemed to get the best review.  Chips certainly are different to the greasy home fries I used to cook, but I've got to loose weight and at least this way I can still have my chips. It takes surprisingly little oil to coat the chips before cooking, I've even tried the Fry Light spay at only 1 cal per spray.  I still crave the grease and fat but this fryer allows you a healthy lifestyle, Thanks to Philips I can still have my chips

Although i cannot deny this air fryer is healthier for me, it basically a chip pan, i've tried cooking other stuff like chicken and fish which are ok but look anemic. However it does cook the chips fairly well and they are crispier.  have even done the slimming world chips in the airfryer and they turned out better than i ever did them in the oven

Cooks food really brilliantly, not very noisy cheaper than an actifry and I can  enjoy foods such as roasted veg and chips with no fat at all. only down side is when cooking chips they need shaking or string every 4-5 minutes which is a bit of a paoin but worth it food tastes amazing, is worth the money would recommend if want a cheaper version of the actifry

The appliance works quite well and the results for most foods are good.  It is good for the lack of oil in chips etc.  However the disappointing thing is its appearance.  It is an ugly object in the kitchen especially in black
Excellent enjoying fries and other food not soaked in oil! !!! !!! !!! !!! !!! !!! !!! !!! !!! !!!
Very poor product, gone back to my deep fat fryer, tried it using small amount of oil, chips unevenly cooked, followed instructions, constantly shaking basket, not a patch on my deep fat fryer.
I have found this item to be just ideal for as i live alone but if you had a big family it would take to long.
Was unsure about this initially but soon came round! Food is tasty and not oily! Easy to keep clean too!
Wow....... bought this on a complete whim as I wanted a bargain on Black Friday and couldn't think of anything I actually wanted.
I live in Spain and these things cost upwards of 150/200euro, so to see one for under well under £100 including delivery I thought I'd take a chance.
Delivered in under a week, opened it up and it looks great, well made and not out of place on the worktop.
Decided to rummage through the fridge and freezer to see what we could find to test it on.
We had frozen chips, frozen parnsips, a potato (made some chips out fo these) and some small peppers.
It is very good  I have cooked quite a few different things &all have been nice &crispy
It came very well packed &arrived when I was told it would be

Fantastic product, I now have 2 they are that good. I purchased the first one in black last year and made great use of it.  I wasn't convinced until I tested it myself.  I make chicken without any oil and my family are simply blown away that there is no oil added.  I no longer ever fry chips as they go in here and are cooked within 10 minutes or so.  It does everything that it claims.  I found the grill difficult to clean, especially with chicken, so I line the basket with a piece of foil at the bottom, that way once the cooking is done, I simply throw out the foil, brilliant.  I recently bought my second one in the off white colour for my work-home, it is well worth the price as it is an investment in health.  Would highly recommend to anyone who hates the smell of oil when frying, or the time it takes to oven bake ( there is no smell of oil, and the time it takes is much less than a conventional oven).  You simply turn the knob to the desired time for cooking (the manual tells you the timing needed for whatever you're cooking) and then you can go off and do other things.  The fryer simply turns off when it's done.  Food doesn't become dry like with other ovens I've tried.  This is by far the best electric item I'd invest in. Highly recommend!

Am really impressed with this.  Have been looking at Actifry for ages, but this one has a big basket and is very neat looking.  Chips are lovely cooked in it, as are breaded chicken and even jacket potatoes.  Little cook book came with it and apparently you can make cakes in it!  Shall be experimenting over the Christmas break!
Makes a noise when you use it - not overbearing though.
Easy to wash.
took some getting used to, but wouldnt be without it now,  use it every day. Heats or cooks pies saves putting the normal oven on. and is much quicker
This was bought to replace a 2 year old deep fryer which was on it''s way out.
I bought this based on the glowing reviews and I'm not disappointed. It's built well, easy to operate and much more easy to clean than my old chip fryer.
The chips taste like they're fried but does not have that greasy taste to them.
Better than expected so easy to use no smells and very little cleaning required all with the added benefit of being healtheir

I've been a fan of the teal Actifry for a couple of years now so when this phillips version was on offer I decided to give it a try ""WOW"" anything from chips to a roast beef joint it's never let me down and so easy to clean .My actifry is gathering dust now and will stay that way .looking for a bigger version next 5 stars

Very disappointing.  Insofar as chips are concerned this was an absolute No No!!  I tried with my own home made chips, using Maris piper as I would do using a deep fat fryer, they were crispy on the outside but dry in the centre and rather tasteless.  I also tried with frozen and found they were better cooked in the top oven, same reason, just too dried out in the air fryer.  I have to be honest and say I have not tried any further recipes but as I bought this hoping to do away with the deep fat fryer this is the reason for my 2* rating.

Absolutely love this airfryer! I got it on black friday for £50 (which i couldn't resist) I have only really cooked frozen products in this so far but it cooks them so much better than the oven and they are much tastier! Saves on washing up a tray each time you cook and saves me having to heat up the oven before cooking. Really can't recommend enough!
I paid out for one of these and I have never looked back, I have used it every day since.

I mainly use it to make chips out of potatoes. Just cut them up and throw them in on 200 degrees with one table spoon of oil. Give them a shake after 15 minutes, then check on them after 30 minutes and they should be ready.
Less fattening and beautiful.
My only grip is how hard it is to clean the mesh and base, the base only just fits in the sink!

It's okay...I cannot say much more than that really. I bought this on sale and I'm glad I didn't pay 200 for it as I'd have been very disappointed. The compartment is tiny and only any good for cooking one portion or maybe two portions of chips. It's essentially like a mini oven and you can cook most things in it if you can fit them!  I've done potatoes many times and they're good and quite quick but otherwise not good for much else!

The airfrier is absolutely amazing! we have used it for chips, sausages, sausage rolls, chicken everything. gives your meat a nice crispy coating without the need to deep fry them. It can be used for anything that you would put in the oven and it takes less time to cook.

I purchased my first fryer a couple of years ago and brought this one in December so I now have 2!! I use my oven approximately 3 times a month now! These have completely taken over saving me lots of money. I use it for anything and everything, pretty much anything that I would put in an oven or fry-it’s so versatile and the enclosed booklets/recipes just don’t give that justifice as by reading them I thought I was quite limited to what I can use them for but I have quickly learnt that isn’t the case at all!

My only niggles is that i still can’t get the hang of the chips/fries and wedges! They don’t taste half as good as I had have expected I have tried numerous recipes/cutting techniques etc but they all turn out the same but I think that’s me and not the fryer!! The other thing is how small it is, I know there is a later model which is larger but it’s still not very big! I would love to be able to just have one of these on my worktop instead of 2 so fingers crossed it’s invented soon!!!
Love it,  I can have chips without feeling guilty.  Would recommend to anyone watching their waistline.  So easy to use.
Could not recommend this highly enough... this is a must buy item at a fantastic price (£89.99) when I bought.
If you follow the instructions the first few times then experiment a bit with your food, it works perfectly well and is VERY low maintenance.

Whoever did this failed to think of one thing CLEANING. Once grease(from making wings)gets on the upper part where the heater is it's literally an entire adventure to clean it. The small tray that it comes with,again, it's so damn thin so once you have grease on it cleaning is a pain in the a**.It's also noisy so if you live a shared flat don't cook after certain hours :D It's also quite large as it takes plenty of space on my kitchen counter.On the bright side it gets the job done really fast and really good. Would recommend if you really want to have one as it's not really a must have in the kitchen.

This Philips Airfryer does as it promises and makes pretty good chips from scratch or using frozen chips. It's a little noisy and the basket/drawer assembly is a little awkward to use and getting just the right cooking time might take a little practice. It's great that it uses so little oil. It also makes pretty good sweet potato chips too.
Did not realise it would be so large. Purchased it without seeing it on my daughters advice. Feel there was a lot of fiddly work to do before you got round to cooking chips. But it did what it said.
Very disappointed with this product!
Felt poorly made and above all the chips were not as expected, pale and not crisp?
This is an OK machine which does exactly what it says on the box. It is easy to use and makes no mess.
The resultant chips however are not as nice as those from a deep fat fryer
This is a handy machine for making various foods that you might otherwise deep fry or cook in the oven. For this reason I can give it 3 stars.

However, the pan was always difficult to clean fully and you can’t use anything abrasive on it. After 11 months of not more than once or twice weekly use, if that, part of the coating started to come off the pan.
I contacted Philips customer care first via the Airfryer app and received no reply. I then rang them and apparently there was no record of the contact even though I had email confirmation!

The lady I spoke to on the phone was helpful but needed to get support from someone else so requested I send photos of the damage which I duly did. The response was rude and accused me of misuse of the product and of using abrasive cleaning products.
Try another brand for your money!

This product is fantastic!!! it is one of the best things I have ever bought and would  and have recommended it to everyone,once you use it you will wonder how you did without it.It cooks chicken superbly and if you are in a hurry jacket potatoes and roast type potatoes are beautifully cooked.

This machine is very noisy and takes up a lot of space but makes good chips from scratch and OK from frozen but probably needs less time than advised if frozen. Easy to use and fairly sturdy. We like it and its chips. I haven't tried anything else from the cookery book yet.
A very nice product,.prompt delivery,..well made quality article..I would recommend this lovely article to family and friends..Thank you very much!
We bought this initially only to get better ready made fries without adding too much fat. Since then it has become my most used kitchen appliance.
Not only am I now making my own fries from scratch, it also does great other foods.
This comes with a small cookbook for inspiration and all of the dishes work perfectly well - highly recommended.

The delivery was spot on.  Food is quicker cooked and a lot healthier.  It has got to be more cost effective to heat this small appliance for chips etc than heat a standard sized oven. The cook book with it is a good help but I could really do with more ideas on what to cook in it.  Its is a lot cleaner to have standing in your kitchen than your standard fat fryer.  Find it is good for two people, not sure on portion size for a family.  Especially if they eat lots of chips!!! perish the thought.
Worked well but fiddly to clean.  Now an essential in my kitchen, especially with the divider. Takes longer than I had expected but not irritatingly so.
An excellent product. Well thought out. Easy to operate.
Had to experiment with times and settings.
Very easy to clean.
Not at all what I expected.
It produces dry, tasteless food.
so it's basically a funny-shaped convection oven
It didn't fry what i expected to( plaintains) , it just roasted it.
i admit I didn't find any info about whether it would or not but decided to take the chance and it didn't pay off. i am now trying to get rid of it.

The Amazon advert was incorrect and miss leading as the product is not as advertised ie. There is no separator in the package this is clearly advertised in the video of the product. On contacting Phillips the product for the European market does not have a separator. The separator  was the  main reason for purchasing this product over other brands.
Very very disappointing !!!

I have made my own chips just got allow 30 mins in cold water to get rid of the starch but i find oven chips cook quicker in this and taste great. I have done southern fried chicken fillets, in the oven the underside doesn't crisp up the same but in this it was crisp all over. Onion rings take 4 mins.I find turning the chips every five mins better than just once. Only downside I had to wrap the fillets in foil to keep warm while did chips, other than that it would have got a five star

This is an absolutely great product. Homemade and frozen chips taste nicer than fried chips. The moisture in food is retained which is a lot better than the grill or frying.  It's really simple to use, easy to clean, and overall more healthier. Would highly recommend this as it will reduce your oil intake dramatically.  Next on the list is to bake a cake which is also possible with the air fryer
I took a long time to decide to buy this fabulous machine and I am not disappointed. I spent a few days trying out its many paces, oh joy! It has earned a permanent place in my kitchen.
Takes a little getting used to but worth the wait to finally get rid of cardboard oven chips, and half the calories of fried immersed chips.
Having never used anything like this before I am very impressed with both the price and look of this fryer. It is so easy to use and cooks really well

I love it, my husband (luddite) doesn't. But them he won't eat potatoes unless they've been drowned in fat as I've just discovered. Still, I've got round that and started buying sweet potatoes instead. Go Phillips Go!
Firstly let me start in saying I really love the Philips AirFryer! The chips it makes feel so much healthier then the standard greasy deep fat fryer.

I'm deducting 1 star for the basket. It's made from a metal mesh that has really sharp edges that leaves it really hard to clean. I've no dish washer so I'm constantly getting fluff from dishcloths stuck to the mesh, not impressed with it.
Apart from that it's really good
Simply amazing! Used to do different stuff (not only chips) and it is unbelievable!!
I would recommend this to people who would like to eat fried food with lot less oil!
best thing i have bought ,cooks all the kids things in minuetes,no need to use my oven ,does great wedges roaties ,pizza nuggets sausage you name i tried it
My wife always wanted one of these in WHITE but did not make it in white so we bought a tefal actifry now we have this she is made up.
E.V.Buckleu.
So far I have cooked oven chips, home made chips, roast potatoes, sirloin steak and a cheese omelette in my airfryer.
A good all round vessel for good healthy food,cooks very well.Still learning to use it but i would recommend it to others.

Excellent for making chips without oil and also cooks sausages and other things well although does take longer than the specified time.  I bought a divider (shame this isn't included with the package) as it then makes it easy to cook 2 separate things.  It is adequate for 2 people but not for a larger family unless you just want chips.  Overall I am pleased with it but have not been overly adventurous so far.

Just bought this and found it bigger than i thought, but very stylish.  I tried fresh potato chips but were not that impressed.. they were not crispy at all, then i tried frozen chips (not oven chips) the frying type ,  and they are the best just a spoonful of Rapseed oil
and they were crispy and golden and lovely.  Highly recommend this machine and the recipe book that comes with it is very useful.....gives some great ideas.

Can't recommend this item enough. I have used it many times over the last few months, for things like barbecue chicken, southern fried chicken, garlic bread, cheese on toast, oven chips. Very versatile, but it is more the convenience that I like; just insert food and set the timer. So much more efficient than using my oven, chicken is done in half the time. Going to try veg soon.
been waiting for a great product like this.  cooks food great without  the grease ..would recommend  this product to all.

So very happy with my Philips Airfryer. Cooks the food crisply and quickly. I've tried the potato cubes and wedges recipes from the book provided, but instead of using liquid oil, I've used Frylight, and it works brilliantly. I've also done oven chips, bacon and tomatoes, ready-prepared Mediterranean veg and ready-prepared vegetable chips from Tesco - Fantastic! A great bit of kit for anyone following the Slimming World plan too!
Its amazing how fantastic chips come out of it.  So crisp and dry.  I absolutely love it.  Best product on the market.
Very pleased with it.  I bought the extra layer insert, which makes it more versatile & doubles the capacity.  A pity it's not included.

The cookbook supplied with it is very basic, & I was going to buy a book.  However, I found a great app - from Philips - with lots of recipes.  I do think Philips could point this out to their customers.

I have had the fryer for two weeks.  I initially used another type of potato that I had been buying but the results were very poor so I changed to the maris piper potatoes as recommended in the instructions, I have soaked the cut chips for half an hour to remove excess starch (no quick meal here!), I have dried them on kitchen towel, I have coated them in a little oil by hand and have finally cooked them for 25 minutes (a quantity for two very average portions).  The chips were raw.  We ate the rest of the meal whilst the chips cooked for a further 25 minutes.  They were then cooked but too much trouble to be bothered with on a regular basis.  Makes me want to go back to the deep fat fryer where I could peel the chips quickly whilst the fat was heating.  Not my finest buy.

Really happy, This is a excellent Air Fryer and I wish I had found it sooner, it Works like a charm, frozen fries come out perfect, even better if you use oven chips which are pre oiled, the chips come out crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. As expected they will not be indenticle to fried chips however there isn't that much of a difference and this being a healthier option makes it an obvious choice.
It appears to cook everything I throw at it, meats come out really well, for me the best thing bout it is the time it takes it is really fast, as I can have a meal cooked in less than 15 minutes
All in all this is a much healthier option, and you still get a very close taste of a traditional fryer, very easy to use, highly recommend this.

What a wonderful fryer it made my chips taste great and no oil i have even  made a chocolate cake cant wait to see what other goodies i can make once again thank you amazon for making it so easy to buy from your site and your good service etc you really are a good company

I liked the clean lines of the product and the price.tips- squaring off the chips at both ends to ensure even cooking and oiling the chips in  a seperate bowl and stirring before loading makes them look like the real deal.

Great purchase and love using it..came in nice time, well packaged, put to immediate use and was pretty impressed with outcome, food, especially the chicken retains it's juiciness, frozen chips nicely done as was other food items..
It's so easy and effortless to use, I come home late from work, throw the food items in, run around doing chores and come back to a nice ready meal.
Cleaning couldn't be more simple, just remove basket and bottom section, wash and replace.
The books come in handy, still experimenting but so far, really pleased with purchase, result and cost of such item..

More versatile than I originally thought and I do like it. However the accessories are way too expensive the manual timer is not very accurate and if you are not within sound range when it finishes there is no way to tell it has finished, (a colour changing light would be useful). The most annoying aspect is how difficult it is to clean around the heating element when finished. If I had to replace it tomorrow I would pick the Philips but I would go for the electronic timer version.
better thanI expected ,I live on my own and can cook a meal in double quick time , would reconmend it , would make a ideal present

bought as a gift to someone, I already own one for 2 years and I am very impressed with it, healthy way to cook fried foods chips etc, built in timer so you don't accidently leave it on seems much safer than regular oil fryers and of course healthier  couldn't recommend enough 10/10

This is my second Air Fryer from Philip's my other one has seen better days but it has been used virtually every day for 18 months so well worth the money. When I was looking around for a replacement I checked the supermarkets and the catalogue store and this was 50% cheaper! The seller gave me a delivery date but it arrived 4 days early. Very happy with the product and the seller.
The fryer cooks everything well, ive cooked the usual chips etc but it cooks everything I have thrown at it perfectly. Love it!
Had my doubts that I'd use this regularly and thought it might end up in the cupboard like a lot of other kitchen gadgets, but this this is brilliant and we use it 2/3 times per week.

I was dubious regarding the claims and this seems too good to be true.For now the quality if chips and nuggets is quite good.It is a matter of tweaking ,a tablespoon of oil especially on store fries keeps them soft and crispy without drying them.The con of having this as that it the timer knob cannot be reversed so if the food is cooked you just have to switch off the main power supply and let the timer run its course.
I was shocked at how well this machine works. Chips take around 12-16 minutes. The finished result was supurb, much better than an ovan. I would fully recommend this product.
THIS IS OK NOT WORTH SO MUCH MONEY THOUGH.
HAVE TO WATCH THAT IT SMOKES A LOT AND IS NOISY
this is by far the best" fryer" I have owned, I have cooked many different thing in it and the results are always good  would highly recommend  this item
I really like the air fryer it does what it says on the box my family say frozen chips the best
This is even better than I expected, (also as my husband now does some of the cooking)
and he is 80
it's a lot of money for a fryer,healthy perhaps but not worth the money for poor chips

It may work fine with the recipes in the book, did not try, but does not work with chips, they are not crispy and golden, if you like them soggy and soft them this air fryer is for you, if not, do not purchase one, I have returned mine!

wasn't quite sure about getting one, as I do like my potato fries and had doubts it would be any good. I was pleasantly surprised at the crispiness and taste of fries prepared in this air fryer. if you love your fries and are trying to cut down the amount of oil used, then you should get this air fryer. other items have been hit or miss. fish has been pretty good, but not every time. I think it may be down to temperature adjustment and duration. but so far so good.
My wife and I r both disabled and this is best cooking utensil we have ever bought thankyou  very much

I am certainly no Super Cook, in fact quite basic. Having only had the air fryer 3 days, I have cooked two meals in it, the first a Lamb Steake, the Steake was superb, really juicy, maybe could have been cooked a little longer as it was on the grey side of pink, second meal was frozen cod and oven chips, a little over cooked as the fish was a bit burnt, the chips were great.
My only grouse is that on first look at the included recipe book, it looks that all you can cook are fish fingers and chips, really need to expand what really can be cooked in the fryer...
Yes it does what it says on the box but I would still rather have unhealthy, crisp, chips cooked in a deep fat fryer
Still trying to get slimming world chips the correct shade of golden brown, I don't think for me it was worth the amount of money.

I have not used this myself yet but have had rave reviews from my sister who has had one for a few years and has even bought my mother one for this Christmas. Mine is also a Christmas present from my parents, so now the whole family has one.

A great buy. Worth every penny for healthy chips / sweet potato wedges and chicken. Comes with a recipe book which gives great ideas for sweet and savoury foods. I really love this and it has changed how I cook as I now have more 'fried' foods but know it is healthy still.
Have tried my new airfryer and it is brilliant wish I had bought one sooner rather than later as no more cleaning as mine goes in the dish washer

Absolutely love this device. We make a lot of chips with it (both normal and sweet potato) and its easy and much healthier than normal chips. You could cook all sorts in this thing and its easy to put on, set the time and heat and leave it be. Its by no means quiet but not ridiculously loud either. A great addition for cooking food.

This is a great machine.  Have cooked a variety of things.  Bacon, sausages, chips, chicken, scotch eggs, croutons, fish fingers!  Haven't tried anything sweet as yet.  Especially useful as I don't have to watch it like you do a frying pan, can carry on with other things whilst it cooks.
A nice fryer with the added benefit that it's healthier than the deep fat option.  The need to use the timer as the on/off is a little irritating and can be fiddly to clean.

I absolutely love it - for its ease of use and its versatility - variable temperature controls; a working timer; ability to cook two items at the same time; ability to cook a wide range of foods; easy cleaning; odour free; healthy food.........
Admittedly it is large and heavy but this maybe an indication of its 'build quality'.

I love this product. Kept going backwards and forwards trying to decide if I wanted or needed an air fryer.  This is brilliant. Cooks chips and other items perfectly which make's me annoyed I waited so long. Basket is rather small though which is the only negative
I havent use it yet but my sister did and she loved it!
Fast and food is very tastefull... recommended

This is the most used appliance in our Kitchen and easily the best buy ever. It offers a new cooking experience, without cooking in loads of fats and even Vegetables are better, and Chips are to Die for.

Certainly does what it says on the tin.  We had never had an air fryer before. We were impressed by other reviews so we gave it a try.  I'm a real chip fan.  We have had it for almost 14 months now and get super results every time.  One of the best gagets I've bought and I'm into gagets.
Far better than oven chips and almost as good as real french frys but less fat.
We had a few dissapointments in the early days such as not cooked evenly and funny taste. Discovered this was due to using wrong oil, wrong type or not fresh potatoes.

We have learnt that it is important to; use an oil that can withstand high temperature so that taste is not affected, we use ground nut oil. select potatoes that are best suited to chips. use fresh potatoes. cut chips uniformly, we use a potato chipper and I prefer small almost french frys size. soak the chips in water for 20 mins changing the water a couple of times, dry them thogoughly before applying the oil. put chips into a bowl sprinkle on the oil and shake them round in the bowl till they are all evenly coated. tip the chips out into the bowl you used to apply the oil a couple of times during the cooking process, gives a more even cooking effect. Thoroughly clean the chip pan and container after each use.
We have found it best to cook for longer at 170 C rather than shorter time at 200 C.  Too high a temperature will burn on the outside but not necessarily cooked through.

I bought the Philips air fryer to replace my deep fat fryer in order to comply with a change in my tenancy agreement.  With the deep fat fryer the process of making home made chips required merely peeling and chopping the potatoes and dropping the in the fryer.  With the Philips air fryer the process is a bit more involved.  After having been chopped into shape your chips will need to be patted dry with a paper towel or similar and then oiled prior to cooking.  The manual also recommends soaking the chips for 30 minutes prior to drying and oiling them but I have found this to make little difference and no longer bother with this stage.  On the plus side the resulting chips are crisper than those I cooked using a deep fat fryer and are presumably healthier too.  Also my flat-mates have been impressed with how well the air fryer cooks oven chips (which are what it is actually designed for) and it is less smelly and easier to clean than the deep fat fryer.

Prick the potatoes with a fork then microwave on full power until you can push a knife into the centre without it feeling hard; then pop in the airfryer for a perfect crispy jacket (see photo).  Be warned though, it only takes 3 or 4 minutes for them to crisp up so don't go wandering off.

I've had this for over a year now and to be honest I'm not overly impressed. I'm not gonna lie, the airfryer is a breeze to keep clean and of course it's a much healthier way to fry food. That being said, all the food I specifically got it for, frozen chips, fish fingers, roast potatoes etc taste completely different to how they do when they're traditionally fried. You don't get the crispness. To add to my disappointment, the front no longer stays in place so it belches steam after 20 minutes or so. I rarely ever use it now as I get much better results using my oven. Having not had a chip pan in the house for the best part of 20 years it is great to have home made chips again. Just make sure you follow the instructions and make sure the chips are slice evenly (I bought a manual chipper) and soak for about 30mins to remove the starch, pat dry then add the tablespoon of oil and coat the dry chips. I also use a vaporiser filled with oil just to make sure they are coated. Using the normal setting for chips 180DEG for 20mins (after heating for 5mins) - Shake after 10mins (I also spray a fresh coting of oil on them at this point) and you will get great chips. Cooks chicken, sausages just as well - very pleased with the fryer.

I've had this for a few weeks and I think Philips has understated the functionality of this.  I have a well eqiped kitchen but I'm using this more and more.  It's not an item that will end up stored in the garage.

Firstly - chips!  I use Maris Piper, cut large; blanche them in boiling water for 3 minutes; let the water evaporate off and cool; then I use some olive oil to cover them (using my hands!) and cook them for around 15 minutes at 160 followed by 15 minutes at 180. They never stick, they are crisp outside and fluffy and flavoursome inside.  THEY ARE MUCH BETTER THAN DEEP FRIED CHIPS - I know because I have Lincat professional double fryers - and they are now in the garage.  I even now use it for my roast potatos.

I've also been experimenting. Because they are "Air" they are also great at things like warming croissants.  Bring the temp up to max then pop a croissant in for 2 to 3 minutes.  Crisp just like in France.  Also ..... chestnuts!  30 minutes at 160.  I've also done some great Char Siu Pork.  Because it blows air and the meat doesn't sit on a surface - it cooks without burning sugars.  It's also great at sausages .....  Anyway if in doubt .... buy.

I previously owned the Tefal Actifry and when that wore out after five years of use we thought we'd try the Philips air fryer.  The Philips Air Fryer is far worse than the Actifry as it doesn't have a moving paddle that turns the chips.  The result is that the Philips burns the chips on one side while they're raw on the other.  This doesn't happen with the Tefal as the rotating paddle flips the chips over to prevent them being burnt.  The Philips  instructions day that one needs to take the basket out and shake it every ten minutes but that doesn't seem to help much.  With the Tefal one just put in the chips and twenty minutes later they're done.

I would recommend getting some of the accessories, whilst  even if you shop around  they are expensive they make life a lot easier, you can also find silicone baking trays in bargain shops for  next to nothing that can be cut down to fit. Build quality seems brilliant  the exact opposite of the tefal actifry in this respect in fact!
Update: I use this every day and so far 200% reliable it is a brilliant time saver and cooks really well, much better designed and built than the tefal actifry I have before which was very fragile

As I've said, this does everything I'd expected it to do.  I just love it.  After a lot of research looking at both the Tefal and the Philips I decided on the Philips because it takes up less workspace than the Tefal and the price was better.  I have a small kitchen and appliances that get used regularly stay on the work top so it had to look good too.  A visitor came into the kitchen and said "where is it then" so it does fit in.

Love this, I bought it in a lightning deal, so very reasonably priced, I use it nearly every day and not just for chips, at the moment my jacket potato is being cooked to perfection and it does the best crispy bacon ever. A bit on the small side, but it and do a fab full English in 20-30 mins (not the eggs though, they would drip through the basket!)
I used this for the first time last night.  I was bowled over by it.  I was not expecting much as things like this often turn out to be gimicks but...

Firstly, this arrived in the MOST ENORMOUS deliver box from Amazon.  I struggled to get it through the door at work and then had to sit with it taking up half my room all afternoon.  It just about squeezed into the car.  The Philips box inside was a little smaller and the actual Airfryer was smaller still.  A bit unnecessary.

It is quite a heavy thing and the one complaint was that the actual cooking basket is relatively small.  It did 2 large portions of chips for me and my wife but we would struggle to feed the kids too.  That was an 800g batch - the recommended max although I could have put a few more in.

The process is simple.  Just cut the potatoes after peeling.  add a small slosh of oil and coat the chips.  Pour them into the Airfryer having preheated for 3 minutes.  Shake after 9 minutes and leave for another 9 minutes.  Then perfect chips.  Not greasy but crispy but really tasty chips.  You could actually taste the potato unlike with floury oven chips.  I was really pleased.

Cleaning consisted of bunging the tray and net into the dishwasher - takes up quite a lot of room and that's it.  The outside of the machine did not get at all dirty.  There was a faint smell of cooking but no smell of chip oil.  The unit is quite noisy but not bad enough to disturb.

So, this was great.  I am looking forward to cooking spring rolls next.  The recipe book does all sorts including fish fingers (home made) etc.  The separator allows you to cook 2 individual items at the same time.  The only down side is that the cooking area is not quite big enough.
I am not sure if this will turn out to be value for the quite large price tag but I am very pleased with this and recommend it thoroughly.

Looks great, but before I had even used it, I had it on the counter and pulled the bottom basket out and the base unclipped and fell to the floor broke the front white basket. My fault but a bit of a design error - helpful it didn't have hot fat in ! If anyone know where to replace the front white plasic bit it would be helpful.

Very impressed by this 'air fryer'. It not only looks good, is healthy, but for many things it has replaced our oven. Probably not suitable for a family but great for cooking for one or two. To start off we had a go at chips, this is why we got it. I have never liked the deep fryer and pan cooked chips are smelly and unhealthy. We started off without adding any fat at all. The result for me was a bit too dry. Still a good chip butty with lashings of tomato sauce though! We found that the recommended spoonfull of oil worked a treat. The chip pan has finally been sacked in our house!
Chip's

The airfryer is effectively a mini oven and it basically can do anything a normal oven can do as well but unfortunately nothing extra. But it is annoying to clean it after every use and it also takes a lot space in the kitchen. If you do not have an oven yet, get this product or maybe buy a real oven but do not expect anything on top...
Not used this yet but it looks good!

the fact that it does not turn itself off once timer is up is a bit shocking, mine almost went into melting upon first use as when timer is up the fan turns off but the heating remains. Cheap construction. It does well what it needs to do but in this modern world more convenience would be preferred. better programming than a timer simply.
My little boy loves chips but we don't want him to eat any deep fried food. This "amazing" fryer seemed like a good alternative; it has so many positive reviews.

However, we were totally disappointed. Despite following the instructions and shaking the chips every few minutes, we never got properly cooked chips. The chips were always burnt outside, mostly in the corners, and raw inside. We tried both fresh and frozen chips and the results were always disapointing.
This "fryer" is just a small and expensive fan oven. Waste of money!
It was much larger and heavier than I thought and I had nowhere to store it.

The product works ok but I can't help thinking I have wasted my money. It's not a fryer it cooks through hot air so I could get the same result from my oven. You don't get that deep fried taste and texture. Yes it's healthier than a normal fryer but this is not a fryer! I wish I had saved my money and just used my oven instead.

I've been using mine a couple of times a week for two years now. It makes great chips and roast potatoes. The downside is that, in spite of keeping it as clean as possible the fryer now stinks of old oil whenever I use it. Having to throw open the back door and windows after use in winter is not ideal.  I went on "chat" with a Philips customer services operative and they confirmed my suspicion that there is NO FILTER and no way to address this issue. I am now left in a quandary...do I buy another as I am familiar with this knowing it won't be a long term item in my kitchen or try another manufacturer and hope for the best?

Had the air fryer for over a month now and it is definitely living up to other reviews of being quick and easy. Being able to make a small tea or snack in no time at all makes life so much easier and saves on having to wash up pans or trays. It is now one of our go to appliances when cooking meals whether it be the simple bite to eat or cooking something for part of a full on meal.
Would recommend for all.
Big, noisy and no better than a decent fan oven.
Sent back.
I can see why for some people this would work out well.
But we hated it.

A real gem. Quick cooking and excellent results. What's most important that you do not have to add oil, or very little, even for chips which come excellently cooked. But you can nearly cook everything in this! Compact and smart appliance, excellent for one or two persons.

Fantastic piece of equipment. We have used this for 3 years now and we absolutely love it. It cooks chips but is also great for roasted vegetables, pies, roast potatoes , jacket potatoes to mention just a few. It is a safer option than deep fat fryers and is much healthier. We prefer to use frozen oven chips which come with a slight oil coating which is ideal for this machine. Fifteen minutes is enough to cook a decent portion of chips enough for 3 or 4 people. Cannot recommend it highly enough !

Love this air fryer, pretty much has replaced my oven, easy to use,  larger size would be better for a family but this is great for 1 or 2 people.  Does not come with divider had to purchase this directly from Phillips £11.00 including p&p.  Due to non inclusion of divider I give this product 4 stars.

This is one of the best purchases of my life, since it arrived I am eating chips everyday without being worried about the fat. the chips are fantastic super tasty, I only use raw potato because I love the taste of potato. It is very light weight, easy to clean, looks very pretty in the kitchen and I can't recommend this item more.
very handy product for quick hot meals.

This is such an incredible Airfryer it really gives your food flavour and is a lot healthier that a deep far fryer. I use it all the time mostly cooking Sausages, Spuds, Chips etc. I really like this Airfryer it is designed really well and is not too large, it fits in my kitchen perfectly. 5 stars.
Have you ever tasted a raw potato? That's what air-fried chips taste like. They just don't compare with deep-fried chips.
I was disappointed. The Philips AirFryer is OK for heating up some food but a normal oven or a microwave does it better, more evenly.
Don't waste your money on this. The price has dropped 25% since I bought one a month ago.
100 pound chip pan
impossible to make crispy fries and they are unevenly cooked
Not what I expected.....you have to keep checking it.  Tefal Actifry is much more customer friendly.  Haven't returned it because I have used it!!
This is great. Very easy to use and cooks well. Simple dial to set temperature and another for the time. A little noisy and somewhat bulky but it does the job so no complaints.

UPDATE 6 weeks later. Leaves a bit of a smell in the area it is used so have moved to utility room as it was setting off smoke alarms in the kitchen. Is thoroughly cleaned before and after use so it's not like we are recycling the fat the comes off the previously used product.
Philips Airfryer Instructions tell you to cook frozen chips and cut up potatoes direct from the freezer. THIS IS WRONG.

I was doing this, but after a few disappointments, I realized that straight from the freezer the food was full of moisture and that prevents crisping. So now I leave the food to come up to ambient temperature,  you will see how much liquid comes out,  then put them in the Airfryer and they come out nicely cooked and CRISPY.
Clearly the manufacturers have written their instructions from a SELLING POINT OF VIEW not a practical viewpoint.
Well used this loads of times, too many to count, makes scrumptious chips and roast potatoes, brilliant for cutting down on fat in your diet.

I already have an Actifry with rotating paddle, but sometimes items would break up in the pan.  This doesn't happen with the airfryer.  The only criticism I have is that the basket (while ideal for chips) doesn't accommodate a very big bowl for items of a liquid nature.  Not sure if there was a larger model available - if so - my mistake!  Other advantages over the Actifry is the variable temperature and timer control.  Also switches off when cooking complete which my Actifry does not.
ACE!!
Delivered next day and I eagerly couldn't wait to test it out. It came very well packaged (i opted for the 'gift packaging' so it came in an Amazon box) and there was no damage to it at all.

It's bigger than I thought it would be but seems to sit nicely in the kitchen and doesn't look out of place. The basket is a nice size but I wouldn't recommend it for families as it is more suited for 1-2 people.
I decided to try out cooking some homemade chips and it couldn't be more easier, especially since there's a recipe book that accompanies this.
You cut your potatoes into the desired size chips and you can set the airfryer accordingly so you get get crispy chips if you want them.

I bought this about 8-9 months ago. I am satisfied with it. Initially I tried to fry with no oil at all and the result was not great. I now add a tea spoon olive oil to whatever I am going to fry and the results are very good. Of course, deep fry is tastier but not healthy. I am pleased with the fact that my house if not filled with frying smell and that the machine is very easy to clean. it also heaths up very quickly. I do recommend it. I want to buy one for my mum. the only downside is the price!!

I echo all the other positive reviews of this machine. I use it most days for all sorts of things. Have done chips, roasties, toasted sandwiches, roasted veg, sausage rolls, bacon, fish fingers, carrot chips, sweet potato chips, sliced aubergine for moussaka, sausages, some chicken which then went into a stir fry sauce. All v good.

The main reason for writing though is to all those who did not receive a separator. This also happened to me. I went on the Philips website, through live chat and they immediately sent out the separator. Don't let this missing part put you off. Get on to Philips and they will sort it.
To be honest though, I have hardly used the separator anyway.
Chips are definately not like fryed but im using 2 table spoons of oil and it is better. If u use only one 1 spon chips are dry. I tried bake chiken legs and it was very quick and taste was great

Bought this to replace 4th broken Tefal Actifry at a friends recommendation can't believe how much quieter, easier to clean & better it cooks, quicker too and it has 2 year warranty - obviously Philips are more confident in their product than Tefal are & I believe it will last longer as there are no moving parts. I use an airfryer to aid my weight loss plan and have successfully lost over 8st - Couldn't be happier with the product.
It is so easy to use if you can press start on a microwave then you can cook with your eyes shut with this air fryer.

I wish it had come with the baking tray !!. I find frozen crinkle cut chips / Chunky Croquette Potatoes / Chicken Kive & Fish works well, they are crispy on the outside and melt in your mouth.I cooked home made chips just once but did not leave them in water for the required time because i was showing it to to a friend the chips looked a bit bland but they were impressed with the taste but had not seen the quality of the frozen ones. We put a full pack of frozen sausages in ( NOT IN PACKET ) and they cooked in 16/20 mins. If I had grilled from frozen the skins would look dryed out and take a lot longer but not in the Air Fryer. I have tried some meats and they cook well. When you cook just check that the outside is crisp and inside should be done. Any fat is in the bottom of the pan and not on the food.If you forget and leave it on , the house won't burn down and i so easy to clean even a man can do it. Well I did.
Gareth
Excellent.
For someone without much knowledge on cooking, this made life easy frying things without the oily mess. The chips taste nice if brushed with a tiny bit of oil before cooking.

we brought this as a spare not expecting them to be that cheap ever again, but having tried the Dutronic one we think they will stay this cheap or get cheaper or the factory will be full of disappointed customer returns.
I was really kindly surprised, how handy is that and what time is saving me. Really recommend!

When my husband suggested we purchase this item I thought, here we go, another kitchen gadget to clutter the place and gather dust. I was so wrong! This is definitely the best kitchen item I have had in years. It's like a mini fast oven and fryer combined. Anything I would normally fry or bake I  just put in the fryer, the basket ensures unwanted fat drops into the tray below. Fish, bacon, sausages, chicken wings, duck breast, pies, spring rolls, onion rings, spare ribs, lamb chops, they have all come out perfectly cooked. When I get time I plan to try the oven part, see how a cake turns out. In my opinion a really versatile device and well worth every penny.

I am, however, very disappointed in the quality of the interior - after only using it for a short while, the black enamel inside has chipped in various places.  I have not bothered to complain earlier because I am really happy with its performance, but am worried about its life expectancy now the enamel is coming off inside.  Can you please let me know why this has happened and if it is a flaw in the product itself.
Kind regards
Linda Collins

Not much wrong with the frying performance. But the handle seems a bit sloppy, and when - just after the guarantee period had expired - the basket was stuck in the pan, all Philips could recommend was to throw it away and buy a new one. Although with just a hint about how the disassemble the handle, I am sure I could have fixed it without the risk of damaging the thing. Anyway, they also said that for the basket and pan, I would not have had any guarantee at all.
Very difficult to clean the food basket. Be careful, or you have to buy a Non Stick grill pan.

After spilling 2 litres of oil on our new kitchen floor I decided to order something less messy and more healthy. After reading the reviews for the various alternatives I decided to opt for this  ( rather expensive) option. I have no regrets.  OK... I have only cooked perfect  (non-greasy / no oily smelly ) chips, but  i am looking forwrd to trying out other foods in this air fryer.

Unbelievable, but it actually does exactly as it claims!  The best chips I have ever tasted, without any oil.  I was rather sceptical when I ordered it, but encouraged by the satisfaction guarantee I decided to give it a go.  Had an Actifry before, and didn't think anything could be better - but this treasure is magnificent!
Can't recommend it strongly enough.....and the Amazon price is £70+ less than the recommended retail price.
Delighted !
If you like dried brittle chips , buy the bugger. I re=sold mine after one cooking attempt.
a marvellous appliance. I use it for everything. looks good, cooks great
Hello, I just wanted to say how impressed I am with my Philips Airfryer.

I have had it just over a month now and have used it in a large number of different situations, from cooking self made chips and garlic mushrooms to frozen foods all with impressive results. I'm sure my oven chips even taste better when done in the airfryer. There are no unpleasant odours, and I don't own a dishwasher so it needs to be really easy to clean and it is, a little soak in hot soapy water and a gentle wipe, all done.
My six year old boy enjoys making chips or seasoned potato cubes and I can relax in the knowledge that there isn't a big pan of boiling hot oil sat on the side.

Another big plus for me is that there is no real warm up time compared to the conventional oven which can take anything from 15 to 20 minutes to reach temperature, most foods that I have cooked in my airfryer are done in that time.
I would recommend this product to anyone, 10/10 well done Philips well worth the money.
A Little sceptical when i ordered the fryer, but i thought give it a go, sounds to good to be true.
But what a surprise to find it not only does what it says on the tin so to speak but a lot more besides.
Still trying new recipes with it and finding it copes with all i have tossed at it. with flying colours.

Potatoes wise there is nothing it cannot do, Fish, meat does them all, but can sometimes make chicken a little dry, needs a coating to allow enough moisture to last the cooking time. Will do whole meals for one in a fraction of the time, of other methods.
Absolutely brilliant keep up the good work Philips.
Have recommended this item to friends and family.
Scores 11 out of 10 for our family, in use every day.

Absolutely brilliant device. There's no heat up time and chips are ready within 20-25 minutes. I just use fry light spray as I'm on slimming world and BAM! Syn free chips. It can bake cakes, cook meat and fish, and make great chips. There's no need to use oil but you can if you wish. Got this in Tesco for £70 on sale.

Like many others leaving a review on this item I also have had a Tefal Actifry previously, within 2 months the lid latch broke and 6 months later the paddle broke, but all in all we were happy with the food from it. We were then going to order parts or get a new one, looking on amazon I found the philips airfry, and WOW!!!

Just made frozen chips for our daughter, 3 mins warm up, 12 mins with a shake halfway at 200c and perfect crunchy chips with soft fluffy centre. That never happened on the actifry. We have not tried fresh chips yet, but on early results we are very happy and are extremely glad we chose the philips instead of the tefal.

Very good quality, easy to use, i use it to do british breakfast every week. it test better then most of others, its so healthy cause without oil. Depatche quickly. The item does the job well, it is really what i want.And it 's quite worth the price.

although being a little dubious about the manufacturers claims for this product i was more than pleasantly surprised at the results especially chips but i have also cooked other food ie. chicken fish jacket potatoes even savoury stuffing balls.It is also a great deal cleaner and safer than deep fat frying. Iwould reccomend this product to anyone especially at the vastly dicounted price offered on the AMAZON SITE.
This is a fantastic item which delivers much more than I had hoped.

My husband had been advised to reduce his fat intake and was reluctantly about to give up chips, when we saw this item. I was initially sceptical about how good the chips would be, but they have far exceeded expectation. Chips are golden, crispy and dry, without that awful greasy taste that chips cooked in a deep fat fryer have.Most importantly, they use only half a spoonful of oil, and not even all of that is absorbed by the chips.
The item is very easy to clean, and also is unobtrusive on the work top. There are also some fantastic recipes on the Philip's site.
It is not cheap, but new products usually are initially expensive before the cost goes down and what price can you put on good health?

Not only for low fat chips, but chicken, fish, quiche, roasted veg (peppers, parsnips etc)and flat breads that are usually fried. Can not believe that there is NO taste difference - and on oven baked stuff, you only use a fraction of the oven space so heating up is done so much quicker. Husband dropped the base - cost me another £40, but the part arrived promptly.

The name doesn't really describe the product, it does far more than fry.  I purchased ths product to replace a broken Tefal Actifry and was suprised how much better I find it.  Not only does it take less work top space but it can do so much more and as it does not rely oon a paddle to rotate the food fish and other simlar items that would break can now be fried with little oil.
The first air fryer I bought did not work after a few days. The timer knob was sticking and the machine would go off. Replacement has arrived but not tried it as yet. Hope it works better.
For the last year or so, I have been following a pretty decent diet regime - basically calorie counting & avoiding high-fat foods.

Works well if rather noisily. Chips take quite a long time (over 30 minutes) to cook properly but does well with portions of frozen chicken or fish. Not true to describe it as oil-free since you do need to use a small amount of oil. However, nothing wrong with oil, just try to use a "healthy" one.

Looking something like an industrial size coffee percolator on steroids, this is a large (Measurements at its widest parts are Height: 32cm Width: 28cm Depth: 28cm), robust and heavy but stylish kitchen appliance.  The minimalist design has two functional dials - one for the heat setting and another for the timer.  The lower part incorporates a drawer which houses the cooking basket and the upper part houses the mechanism. The basket is removable and easy to clean and comes with a removable divider for use when cooking a couple of different foods.  The power cable retracts into the body and therefore avoids the issue of cable clutter.  The outer body gets very hot when cooking and it emits an unobtrusive humming noise.  It produces no noticeable odour.  It comes with straightforward instructions and a colour recipe booklet.

If you are pursuing a healthy diet this appliance is excellent - it uses minimal oil and, after some initial experimenting, produces really tasty chips. When cooking home made chips you can get near perfect ones if you put in a few minutes effort and prepare them properly:
- Use suitable potatoes.  Supermarket labelled 'versatile' potatoes work fine.
- When cutting the potatoes after peeling them, put them in a bowl of water and then drain them to remove excess starch.
- Dry them with a tea towel.
- Add half a tablespoon of olive oil to a bowl and, a handful at time, coat the cut potatoes in the oil.
- Give the basket 2-3 shakes during the cooking process.
- Adjust the timer to cook them for longer if necessary.
Cooking a very large portion of chips for two adults takes approximately 20 minutes.
I've bought the Air-fryer just over a month ago and it very quickly became the most used item in my kitchen.
The potato chips and wedges come out great without failing.  My husband loves chips and he agrees that in the air-fryer they come out nicer than in the oven and healthier.

I've also tried roast vegetables which came out great and spring-rolls were a great hit.  The desapeared as soon as I moved them to a plate.  Good thing that they take just a few minutes to air-gry...
Highly recommended product!

Pretty good, chips come out almost as if they were deep fried. My teens use this regularly to make home made, fries, chips and sweet potato fries - never seen them so active in the kitchen.  easy to use, easy to clean. A nice to have in the kitchen.

Excellent family fryer. I was optomistic when purchasing this healthy fryer. I have had the fryer for nearly a year and I can say without doubt that it is a good all round fryer and well worth the money despite what other reviewers may of claimed. The instructions with the machine are clear. By using the fryer often, it is reliable and does what it claims. The fryer is easy to use and to clean.

First of all, and as others have pointed out, this is not a fryer. Frying is the process of cooking in fat or oil in a pan or griddle; the Philips Airfryer is a hot air oven. That is relevant to some of the poor results reported by other reviewers. If any part of the food is shielded from the blast of hot air it is not going to be cooked. With chips in particular, loading the basket more than about half-full makes even cooking difficuly to ensure, and the recommended shake halfway through cooking does not do the job. Especially with thin fries, it is better to interrupt cooking at least twice and turn the food over with a spatula.

In this household thin oven fries are usually cooked on a George Foreman grill, with fairly crispy and delicious results and with most of the fat collected in the drip tray. It does not seem to me that the Philips Airfryer does a better job, but nor does it do a worse job. Because we do not actually own a deep fryer, and have not done for many years, there are no super-fatty fries for the Airfryer to save us from.

Considered as an oven, the Airfryer is both fast and versatile. The timings given in the recipe book are suspect, leading to a certain amount of experimentation, and I think it would be huge advantage if there was a window so food could be observed during cooking. The appliance looks somewhat like a motorcycle helmet, and the transparent visor is sorely missed. However, in the short time the tall Philips has sat on our worktop it has cooked items as diverse as fishcakes and parsnips (love 'em) succesfully and quicker than a conventional oven would do. I believe the shorter warm-up and cooking times mean it is more energy-efficient as well.

This is a tough product to summarise. Any home with a full complement of kitchen appliances probably does not need it, and it's an awkward height to find storage for. It would make an impressive gift, but I'll never get it back in the packing.
i was hesitated to buy at first but now that i bought it, i never regret the decision ever. I use it to cook chicken wings, fried chicken, baked apples crumbles, french fries, pizza and many more.
Excellent, works very well.
I recommend.
I'll try and put this in as simple terms as possible, as I like things to be set out clearly when I'm looking for a product.
PROS:
- Brilliantly packaged with every type of cardboard protection known to man. There's no way this is getting broken in the post.
- Very sleek, shiny and cool-looking if you have a modern style kitchen.
- Easy to use. Seriously, any idiot can do it. There's a quick start guide that'll have you up and frying in no time.
- The food tastes awesome. Not greasy, not dry, just great.
- You can cook pretty much anything in it, from cheese-filled peppers to garlic mushrooms to classic sausages and chips.

The Philips Air Fryer is fanastic.  I haven't got as far as baking Brownies in it yet - but vegetables and chips are fanastic and very healthy, especially for those trying to cook with little oil. The basket is easy to clean and there is no mess. It is a little noisy and like other reviewers have said you must take care with the basket when removing it from the base.  But overall I would thoroughly recommend it.
When this works its abserloutely brilliant I am onto my 3rd one now as the fan has failed

This is my second Airfryer. The first went straight to my daughter after a short trial period. Homemade chips are much better than in the Tefal Actifry, which I discarded, after first the paddle broke, then the lid and, after 2 years of use the part of connecting the lid to the main body practically disintegrated, and replacements are quite costly.
While I love chips I didn't want to deep-fry with all the hussle involved, the smell and having to get rid of the used oil.
After a few experiments the chips came out perfect. I recommend starting with a lower temperature, say 160°C, then upping it to 200°C for the remaining time.

Well, in the meantime I've gone low-carb, and here again the Airfryer comes in handy. Chicken wings, drumsticks or thighs, tossed in spices and a little oil, turn out great, as a matter of fact much better than in the oven. I had tried to make them in the actifry as well, but the coating came off, burning in the hot fat, which collected in the bottom of the pan, and the results were not in the least appealing.
I truly recommend this gadget, especially for a household of 1 or 2!

Thank goodness I never paid full price for this! Great for cooking tiny portions for my 4 year old but, for the price I would expect something amazing! Takes up way too much space and us not easy to clean. Pretty crap I would say
Brill no chip fat smells when cooking and more healthier

This is the most incredible gadget I have ever come across!! Being very diet conscious the last thing I would think I would be eating is home made chips! To 'fry' these chips in absolutely no oil but still taste amazing is a revelation!
Good apart from handle breaking on first use, scampi beautiful
What a fantastic airfryer, easy to use and cooks food perfectly.

It is the second one I have purchased and this is nothing like the first one. It is dangerous, when I pull the drawer out with hot cooked food in, the bottom half drops apart,  leaving me holding the just basket, which it should not do. It is a much poorer quality.

Love the Philips Airfryer. Had an Actifry before and liked it but found that the paddle sometimes broke the food up. It was also not well made and the lid broke first and then the paddle. Spares were expensive so decided to try Philips. I use it most days and would hate to be without it now. Heats up really quickly and cooks better chips than the Actifry. My new best friend.

This is an excellent fryer. I was somewhat surprised to discover that it's not only fries/chips you can do - it comes with over 30 recipes for quick & popular dishes. Not very noisy; it's larger and heavier than I expected, but otherwise very recommended.

It does everything it says it will and more, the only complaint I have is that is doesn't come with the widget to enable me to cook cakes.  That in this case in an addition. But it does cook far more than chips. It is efficient, easy to clean and dishwasher safe.My only regret is we didn't buy one years ago!

Really pleased with this air fryer,can be used for all sorts of frying not just chips.Preferred it to the Tefal Actifry as you are restricted with the Actifry as to what you can cook due to the paddle.Does seem to take longer than stated though to cook the food.A great product which saves you turning on the large oven for many meals.Can highly recommend!

I've waited quite a while to write this review to see if I stopped using it - I'm a bit of a gadget freak and my garage is full of things I've thought were going to be great and then after a while I've tired of them and they've ended up unloved and unused - this machine I use every day. The only issue with it are getting the basket in and out - you need to watch out as the release button pulls the basket up and drops the base (which will crack and I've had to replace it once) - so make sure the base is standing on something when you do this and it does take up a lot of room in the dishwasher.  On the other hand it's there, ready to use, heats up in minutes, cooks everything crispy and fast and the timer which switches it off makes it easy for the kids to use.  Love it :D

I previously owned an Actifry for about a year and a half so I think i'm in a great position to compare the two products. I bought the Airfryer about 2 weeks and ago and in that time have cooked Home made bread, Muffins, Chips, Bacon, Hashbrowns, Sausages and everything has come out lovely! i'm really impressed how versitile this product is as traditionally people view these as 'Just for chips'.

The Actifry we owned for a year and a half was only ever used for chips, I always thought it produced good results but was let down in a few ways, the paddle would sometimes mash the potatos up, cause bits to fall off, chips to get stuck at the top so you'd have to knock them back into the dish and my biggest annoyance... when it was finished it would beep but not stop!

The Airfryer is the complete opposite, it produces lovely crisp chips with a soft fluffy inside, if I had to deduct a point it would be that you have to shake the chips half way through (Which for the sake of 10-15 seconds isnt the end of the world). Some people say you have to soak the chips for 30 minutes in water, I've only done this once out of... 3 occasions and the results were the same whether I soaked them or just rinsed them briefly. You also cannot just 'pour' the oil over them and let it mix around like in the actifry, I normally just chuck them in a dish and quickly put a bit of virgin olive oil over them and mix it around.

Home made bread - It took 20 minutes in the airfryer (at 160 degrees for those interested) and produced incredible results! Bacon and sausage cooked beautifully, the bacon went lovely and crispy and all the fat was collected in the bottom and well away from the food. We've noticed that food that should be nice and crispy is (Ie: Hashbrowns, Chips) and foods that shouldn't be somehow just aren't (Ie: Cakes.. they go a nice golden colour and are VERY soft and fluffy on the inside).

Overall I prefer the Airfryer, it's more versatile, quieter and takes up less space. I actually wish I bought this instead of my Actifry back in the day as my Actifry suffered similar issues to others and was a real pain to clean.
NOTE: I've never made bread before in my LIFE so this was my first attempt, the cakes I made were also my first attempt in the Airfryer (I've previously made them in the oven).

Tempura, crispy croutons, thick chunky chips, the list of mouth watering delicacies that are no longer off-limits is endless. Highly recommended.
